review.title: Good value hotel close to SFO with free shuttle
review.reviewText: Hotel is handy to SFO, with a free shuttle operating between the airport and hotel (runs approx every 30 minutes). Hotel staff are very friendly and there is also a 24 hour diner on premises. We booked a tour to the Muir woods and Alcatraz (through Tower tours), with a shuttle picking us up and dropping off at the hotel which was very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to SFO, freindly hotel staff, 12 pm check out.

review.reviewText: Clean facility nothing outstanding minimal comforts

review.title: Reasonably priced and convenient.
review.reviewText: The room I stayed in was reasonable priced and the motel was only about a mile from the San Francisco airport with free shuttle service to and from. The staff members were pleasant and helpful. The room was very clean and quite comfortable. The attached restaurant was only fair, but it was very convenient. The restaurant service was fast and friendly and the atmosphere was family friendly.  I would stay there again if I needed to travel to the Bay Area.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the price best.  I also liked the fact that it was close to the airport and that there was food and wine available in the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant could stand some improvement in the quality of food it serves.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport.

review.reviewText: the front lobby was dirty, the people at the front desk shirts were lobby, no welcome or hello, way too much money for dirty
It was a good night stay, would recommend it anyone.

review.title: Excellent location great area .
review.reviewText: Five stars all around!!! Great restaurant too . Easy acces to major freeways .

review.title: Nice hotel for pet friendly
review.reviewText: Decent hotel, nice dog park down the street. My german shepherd loved the king sized bed with a view. Parking was efficient and easy.  Check in and check out were fast. Maid missed one day of cleaning our room, no biggie though.

review.title: It was tidy, affordable and close to the airport.
review.reviewText: We found it to be in a good position, close to the airport.  It was tidy and affordable and the restaurant was excellent for breakfast and dinner.  Fresh towels every day and friendly and efficient service at the front desk. Free coffee when you were waiting for tours or transfers.  We would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Pick up from the airport took longer than expected, so that would be easily improved.
review.locationRemarks: Mainly the airport but we took tours, buses, taxi's and train to many attractions.

review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, convenient and the pool was an added bonus. And, the restaurant served a great breakfast!
It was a getaway weekend and I have never booked through any third party before at all until I decided to book with Expedia and the low rates per night once I added/compared rates.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: Great stay. Quiet. Close to airport and great value.

review.title: Very good stay!
review.reviewText: Very happy with our stay! Everything was perfect. Pleasant staff, prompt service. We'll be back next year.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant right next to front desk.

review.title: The Front Desk Staff are wonderful!
review.reviewText:
The room was ok but it need to be clean more. It has a per smell and the restroom is dirty.. We only stay for one night so it doesnt matter but if We stay longer I would
Complain.. But the Front Desk staff are wonderful

review.title: Close and quiet
review.reviewText: To SFO for an early flight out.  Free parking is a relief from the city hotels.

review.title: Forgot how bad this place was!
review.reviewText: I stayed here last year on a biz trip and was very bad with the service, cleaniness, and comfort. Unfortunatly, by mistake, I ended up there again! : (   I realized about that nightmare, once I saw the place from the car!  Anyway, I hoped that the hotel has had improved but it was the same.  I do not blame the hotel for what it is, I blame my selft for forgetting about this place!

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: My room faced parking spaces so it was a little noisy.  The furniture was dated.  The bed was comfortable.  Reasonably priced for San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Furniture, bathroom.

review.reviewText: Found insects, bugs in the room. Staff not friendly.

review.title: Fairly decent
review.reviewText: With a fairly well positioned hotel I got to explore parts of California I wouldn't normally go to. I slept in two different rooms and had two different experiences. The first night I slept terribly, as there was a lump in the beg and loud neighbors kept making noises. The second night however redeemed itself and I slept all the way through. It was a nice hotel but I believe I wouldn't pay the same as I did to come back.

review.title: Affordable stay in an expensive area
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was your average joe. Average furnishing, parking, and amenities. Although, the nightstand has USB plugs which are nice. Wifi is terribly slow, but Jay the hotel manager was very awesome.

review.title: Not worth it
review.reviewText: We had a number of problems including a room that smelled of stale urine, a toilet that ran non-stop, a door that wouldn't lock, and more. In the end Expedia helped me to get a full refund which means the management acknowledged their failure.  I appreciate that they did so but I still would not return to this hotel or any Red Roof Inn hotel because of this experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The location near the airport and their shuttle service to the airport was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Inspect rooms for cleanliness (don't let the airconditioner mask the smell), some of the front desk staff, restrict sales of rooms near elevator
review.locationRemarks: Near airport; running path behind  hotels and along the bay has restaurants, coffee shop; golf range/mexican cafe with $5 margaritas across street

review.title: wouldn't stay again
review.reviewText: Man at front desk was very nice, but room was bad. Most uncomfortable mattress and pillows ever. Smelled bad, and people were outside our room talking loudly until 11pm. Walls were thin so we could hear everything from our neighbors. There are better options for the price!

review.title: Nice hotel needs work
review.reviewText: Four people in room 2 towle everyday in room left by house keeping. Had to run down to lobby for extra towels . Paint chipping on off walls in room.

review.title: Decent hotel, nice staff
review.reviewText: Checked us in early when Expedia messed up our reservation, the front desk guy was very nice and allowed us to check in early anyways thanks!
Stayed over night as my flight was early in the morning. Was pleased with the hotel staff and the room.

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: Great spot close to airport with free shuttle bus and cafe.  Everything we needed for quick visit.

review.title: Close, cheap, easy
review.reviewText: Not the nicest place, parking lot makes you feel it is worse than it is. Rooms were clean (we had 3), desk staff were better than good, really responsive and knowledgeable. The attached restaurant is a rip, not clean (greasy booths), bottle of water was $7, just say no. Just down the street from the Hyatt, nice restaurant there and further up the street with views of the bay and incoming airliners.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking lot looks like a drug deal in progress

review.reviewText: Terrible.  Rooms old and run down.  For $200 per night, there wasn't even shampoo in the rooms.  Just a bar of small soap.  No Kleenex either.  Just a bar of soap as far as amenities.  The bath towels We're tiny, old, and felt like sandpaper.

review.title: Nice accommodations close to airport, free shuttle
review.reviewText: Travelling from Ixtapa, Mexico to Vancouver, Canada with overnight in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Speak Spanish

review.reviewText: You get what u pay for. Cheap, damp, hotel. Food at the restaurant is pretty good though.

review.title: Tiny little motor inn
review.reviewText: Tiny room. Dirty parking lot. Park in front of your window...
review.negativeRemarks: Clean exterior
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Horrible experience!
review.reviewText: Was there one night and they gave us the wrong keys twice, called them to send Someone to fix our toilet waited an hour n half still no one called again before we left the hotel and then got back at midnight and it still wasn't fixed, had to send my boyfriend to walk all the way to the front desk from the back building to get new keys then move everything to a new room at almost 1 am. Then we didn't have to check out till 11 and has a cleaning lady knocking on our door aT 9am

review.title: OK for quick stop over
review.reviewText:
Not too far from the airport. The stairways could do with a good power wash and kept clean. I found the staff to be OK, but my room cleaner was a bit miserable. I would stay here again, but only if I was unable to find another place to stay. 
Their website listed free self car parking, but upon checking in, they hit you for another $10.00 per night for car parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Power wash the stairways and common areas and elevators.
review.locationRemarks: The have a diner next to the reception. Other than that, you will need transport to get anywhere else.

review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to find with the GPS. The check-in went very well. The staff was very nice and accommodating. Since we prepaid with Expedia, they comped the parking fee because we were only staying the one night. When we got to the room, we were a little disappointed. The sheets were stained on one of the double beds, but it was a small stain in the corner of the flat sheet. There were only two large bath towels and there were three of us staying in the room. The shower curtain was torn and tattered and the toilet had a tank cover sitting on it that was clearly not meant for it. Overall the room itself was clean and cozy. It served it's purpose...gave us a place to lay our heads for the night.
Good location. Facilities were not clean. Staff were friendly. Paint coming off the wall. Bed spread stained.
The hotel was nice, except for the sticky floor. Probably has not been mopped for a while.

review.title: room
review.reviewText: room ok but the window did not open and it was stuffy unless noisy air conditioner was on. didn't get room made up first night. wi-fi was unreliable.

review.title: Hotel near the San Francisco airport
review.reviewText: This was not the hotel I booked.  I called Expedia to book another hotel which was a 4 or 5 star hotel and was more expensive.  When I got to San Francisco and called my 5 star hotel they said that I didn't have a reservation.   My Expedia agent without telling me booked me into an inferior hotel at a very high rate.
review.positiveRemarks: The desk clerk wouldn't help me with my luggage & I had to walk outside at 3:00 AM in the morning.  I am a senior woman traveling alone & needed help.
review.negativeRemarks: Women should be escorted to their rooms at night.  The outside corridors were dirty as was the elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Didn't use

review.title: close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: close to SFO airport. Bathroom and room floor not clean.

review.title: Needs Met
review.reviewText: A nice, clean room with all necessities on site.  Close to the airport and walking distance to several restaurants and a stroll along the waterfront.  An excellent choice at a reasonable price.
review.negativeRemarks: Very satisfied.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, waterfront walking and view and eating establishments.

review.reviewText: The free WiFi definitely need an upgrade. Each room should have more towels already available. The shower curtain should also be replaced. Otherwise the staff is friendly and the location is good.

I expected that a hotel of this price range would offer at least a continental breakfast, but there was nothing.  There was coffee available in the lobby 24/7 and a small coffee maker in the room.
The room was clean & neat.  The staff was friendly.  I was only there in the evenings & early morning.  I was given no information on the hotel amenities.  

My refrigerator did not work and although staff made a monetary adjustment on my bill, I would rather have had the frig available.

Some staff were very knowledgeable, but others seemed uncomfortable with their role and could probably use a bit more training.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, sufficient and close to what I needed.
review.negativeRemarks: Include a continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: There wasn't much of anything to do.  Location was ok for what I needed.

review.reviewText: Staff was welcoming and friendly. They actually gave us a good spot in a room choice! :)

review.title: Near Airport-Free Shuttle service
review.reviewText: The room needed some ceiling repair and there was a group of young adults using this location for a party. Our room was across from the pool.  It was after 10pm before it got quiet and we had to rise at 4:30 a.m. for our flight. Room is about 75 % as attractive as the picture.
review.positiveRemarks: The efficient shuttle service and the price.
review.negativeRemarks: The security of the door locks and the popcorn ceiling looked as if to much jumping above might cause some shedding of sheet rock.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing nearby except the hotel and airport related business. There was a decent restaurant right off the Lobby.

review.title: Mediocre 'hotel' by the airport.
review.reviewText: We needed to try multiple rooms before finding one that was clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the facility was just not great.

review.title: Room Cleaniness and staff
review.reviewText:
I am giving Terrible for room cleanliness because of cockroaches on sink counter and restroom. Otherwise room was well taken care of by cleaning crew.
Nice lady at reception when I arrived. Next morning, subsequent two male clerks with very poor customer service skills. I waited a few minutes when I went in to relate the roach problem while they attended to another guess. But it seemed that the conversation was mostly personal. When guess departed I moved forward and had to wait a good while while they continued with their personal chat before being acknowledged.
I saw more of the same problem when I returned to room later that evening.

The rooms appear to have been recently remodeled--the interior of the room is relatively nice and comfortable.  I actually really like the (laminate) wood flooring over carpet.

However, I do not like generally motels in the usual meaning of the word, that is the doors to the rooms open to the outside, rather than an interior hallway.

review.title: If there is no where else to stay near the airport
review.reviewText: Yes SFO area is expensive but $200 for this hotel is just sad.  For this money I will go the airbnb route.
review.negativeRemarks: start by picking up the litter around the property

review.title: Absolute dump
review.reviewText: Terrible in one word, there is nothing more to add, the worse facility staff and rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing, just highly priced and sad that expedia recommended this at such high rates, when people waking in where paying probably half the rate.

review.title: Don't Do It!!!
review.reviewText: Awakened to find roaches crawling on my food. (I have the photos to prove it). Room rented dirty, microwave dirty with hair inside. Exposed wiring on the light fixture in the ceiling. This is NOT a 3 star hotel. Guests smoking in the corridors and elevator. Trust me, Don't Do It...

review.title: THEY GAVE AWAY MY ROOM!
review.reviewText:
After a one-hour wait in the TSA line and a 6-hour flight, I arrived at the hotel exhausted at 1:30 a.m.  Since my reservation was prepaid I assumed there would be no problem. "Never assume." No room at the inn, even though I had paid. 

I like Expedia and I liked what I saw of the hotel, but that was little comfort in the middle of the night.  Obviously I'll call ahead next time I have a late flight, but I sure hated learning this the hard way.
Pictures were deceiving. Hotel room was so old specially the bathroom.

review.title: It's nice , clean and quite hotel
review.reviewText: I had a wonderful stay, but only the problem is the wifi I can't connect I called to the hotel staff to fix the connection and they said "ok we try to fix" after a min I try it again but it's the same .
The hotel doesn't look that nice in the outside but the rooms are very nice and spacious.

review.title: Could be better, but could be worse
review.reviewText: The housekeeping is not so great though, my bed had hairs underneath the spread and over the cabinet had dust all over it. The bathroom is very small and the curtain was in very bad condition.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is conveniently located and there is a very nice 24/7 restaurant below it.
review.negativeRemarks: Pay your housekeeping staff more so they can care more about the place.

review.title: Ok place for price
review.reviewText: It was a little dirty but for the price in San Francisco couldn't complain and there was a restaurant next door so it helped out a lot

review.title: This place is clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: The hotel does not look very nice from the outside, but the rooms are clean and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Outside condition looks a bit dirty, elevators, etc were very worn.
review.locationRemarks: Look up Max's Opera Cafe, it is within walking distance. Great food, martinis, and nice waitresses

review.title: A hotel to avoid!
review.reviewText: Very bad experience! Booking hotels via expedia is becoming a very bad decision. Regarding this hotel: (1) The non-smoking room was full of smoke odor, (2) water was leaking on the toilet all night making it hard to fall sleep, (3) could not use the sink to wash hands not brush teeth. Waste water was coming out from the sink! (4) pillows were not clean! Better to sleep on the car!

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to the convention I attended.  Clean and comfortable, but noisy outside.  Very nice staff! The restaurant served very good food for breakfast, but it wasn't free with the room.  I would stay there again.  Reasonably priced.

review.title: Screwed by Expedia and Red Roof.
review.reviewText:
I arrived, looked around, area was dirty as was building.  I cancelled in office with deskclerk. I was told it was cancelled and to cancel with Expedia.
I cancelled with Expedia, or so I thought. 
I was charged one nite for a no show fee. 
Expedia has no record of cancellation and motel manager did not have cancellation. 
BEWARE OF EXPEDIA. RED ROOF INN.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The sf bay view we paid for was non existent, that was the one thing I looked forward to.  The front desk staff wasnt sure where the picture was taken on the website that made it appear there was a view.  They put us in a room with a view of a small lagoon that dried up and had no water in it,  just mud.  Nice.  The room had what was pictured but in person it was nothing to get excited over. Went to the cafe fir breakfast and it was easily the worst breakfast we have ever had.  Won't stay here ever again

review.title: Bed bugs
review.reviewText: My wife got bit by bed bugs here. The front staff used profanity in front of us, very unprofessional. We were booked under the wrong name and had to be woke up, asked to come back to the lobby to resign paperwork without an apology. Will never stay in a red roof again!

This is an older motel style building with poor noise insulation. One side is facing the highway, the other a busy street with a nerby intersection. The hard to regulate AC blowes strong on the bed close the windows - a guarantee one wakes up stiff in the morning.

review.title: Nice facilities but staff ...
review.reviewText: Nice facilities but anything you ask staff ,they said yes but never happens. Ask for extra items and never show up. They do not clean the room for two days until I ask for it.Try to ask to talk to the manager but He was not there. Seriously I had one of the worst experience in my life. Staff is lazy and unresponsive
review.negativeRemarks: Manager and staff
review.locationRemarks: It is awesome

review.title: Reasonably priced, but you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Overall it is a reasonably priced hotel and conveniently located. The condition is okay. I thought, cleanliness was ok before-but I changed my mind when I saw a tiny cockroach in the bathroom.The exterior cleanliness is also so-so, and at the time, there was construction and some noise in the parking lot. Their internet at most times is quite slow. Its a convenient hotel location, and do you get what you pay for.
review.positiveRemarks: special discounted price at certain times, and location
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness maybe, and the internet speed
review.locationRemarks: located in the hotel row of Burlingame, so downtown is very close. Also there are lots of restaurants along the Bayshore Hwy strip.

review.reviewText: Simple hotel. Clean. Nice staff. Great lil' 24 hour diner right next to it. Good food.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel near the airport with shuttle!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the staff, they were very nice and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable, I would recommend this hotel to everybody who is traveling to San Francisco, thank you.
review.positiveRemarks: I really liked the positive attitude of the staff, the room was clean and comfortable, and free shuttle to the airport!
review.negativeRemarks: I was very pleased with this location and the staff.
review.locationRemarks: 24 hour restaurant, free shuttle to airport, BART from airport to Embarcadero

review.title: Close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: Easy access to airport. Surprise $10 parking fee, Expedia information said free parking. Good diner attached to the hotel for breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Older hotel, so keep that in mind. Not so good sound insulation, so for sure you can hear the jets take off from the room. Bring ear plugs to sleep!
review.locationRemarks: Elephant Bar & El Torito are close, but be aware that El Torito is currently undergoing renovations in the bar.

review.reviewText: Beds were not too comfortable  could have been a little c leaner

The hotel parking lot was being worked on ! The parking was limited! The hotel staff at check in was not welcoming ! Inside the elevator one of the staff had a basket of Seatles best coffee , I said oh is the for the guest? She said no VIP!!!

review.title: Red roof
review.reviewText: Did not feel safe lots of fights  broken lamps sink broken taps would not drain  smaller beds not queen as promise I would not stay there again plus never got a recite promise thar Expedia would give me one never got one. Not happy

The hotel is great but the wifi is horrible. Please improve upon it. A lot of people who stay are working professionals and need internet. Otherwise the room was immaculate. The bathrooms, beds etc are very comfy. Correct the wifi issue and I will surely prefer to stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Don't recommend if you have kids
review.reviewText: Room was clean I just don't recommend families with kids... Lot's of people out there smoking weed the smell goes into your room

review.title: Hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: We stayed one night just before an early flight out of SFO.  The proximity of the hotel to the airport was the best feature of the hotel.  We were assigned a handicap accessible room even though it was not requested so the bathroom really ate into the usable space made the bedroom space awkward.  Other than that the room was clean and stocked with towels so we had what we needed.
review.positiveRemarks:
Close to airport
No bugs
Free internet
Free use of printer to print boarding passes
review.negativeRemarks:
No counter space in bathroom
Improve furniture layout in room
review.locationRemarks: Blue Line Pizza fairly close in Burlingame.  They had gluten free pizza on the menu.

review.title: Good shuttle and great location near walk by bay
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed cafe too - friendly staff.
Wanted to book an extra night on Expedia but couldn't find thus hotel online after making the first booking

review.title: nice room
review.reviewText: Nice room. Just make sure your it by the elevators, they are noisy and busy much of the night being so close to the airport.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel for the price. Room was clean. The only complaint I had was there was a urine smell in the bathroom.

review.title: Not for single women or families
review.reviewText:
If you are a single woman traveling or a family this hotel is not for you!  
We arrived at night the room doors all face the outside.  The property is dark and quite a few sketchy people were hanging around.  The elevator reeked of pot smoke, our room door had a huge crack so much so you could see out to the walkway.
 Inside the room was appointed like the photos however it was really small and our room was dirty.  It felt like someone checked in then switched rooms the only amenities were bar soap, no shampoo etc. 
Thankfully we only stayed for about 12 hours, we left much earlier then needed for the airport to get out of there.

review.title: Not the Hilton but clean and cozy
review.reviewText: Perfect for a night or two if you need a reasonable place near SFO. Rooms are clean, the hotel is in a beautiful, safe area. The 24 hour restaurant is really convenient and good for a diner

review.title: Nice hotel with dinner
review.reviewText: About 3 miles from airport. 24hr diner in the hotel. Worth it.. shuttle service to airport. Worth the price.

review.title: Clean but I would call it a motel not hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed the night it wasn't bad clean. Motel not hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Very close to San Franciscio

review.reviewText: The room was quite comfortable. I was expecting breakfast to be included, having stayed at another Red Roof Inn some time ago. It was not, and the meal at the hotel coffee shop wasn't very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a full range of TV channels to watch.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the San Francisco Bay Trail, which is a pleasant walk.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Great hotel! The staff is VERY friendly, however, the AC unit is so loud at night, it makes it really hard to sleep.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: I love that it was near the water and airport.  It was clean and pet friendly.  My dog felt comfortable in the hotel.  It was a 24 hour cafe onsite,  which was awesomeness for take-out.

review.title: Restaurant was nice.
review.reviewText: The reception staff was nice, but the cleaning staff was lacking. Upon our arrival, we found a cleaning rag in our room, and it looked clean until we reached the bathroom. The bath tub was not cleaned properly. There was mildew under the handicap bench, the bottom of the tub felt like it had only been rinsed, and the soap dish felt like it had not been cleaned since the last guest had stayed there. The best part about our stay was the restaurant attached to the hotel. The service was excellent. The staff greeted you within seconds of entering and the food was really good. My husband and I never left without a full stomach and smile on our faces.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleaning staff needs to be retrained.

review.title: Ok hotel for a one night stop
review.reviewText: Beds were ok. Bathroom looked dirty, looked like mold on top of shower or caulking that needed to be replaced.

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: It was comfortable place! It was clean and quiet! It was hygienic and had all the essentials.

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: The hotel was so comfortable and the people so helpful to let's us know what's around n where's to go to get around. The services was good. The rooms were so nice quiet and calm to sleep

review.title: Nice, clean and comfy
review.reviewText: I like check in and check out time very convenient and worth it.

review.title: Nice Hotel but internet access was always down.
review.reviewText: Nice place, Clean room, needs more parking. Internet access most of the time did not work.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was very nice. Remodeled room are nice and cles
review.negativeRemarks: Internet access!!!!

review.title: awful, no way this is a 3.5 star
review.reviewText: Staff absolutely no help,actually it seemed we were bothering them! They were unable or unwilling to resolve our issue.
review.negativeRemarks: staff completely unhelpful no dedicated closet for clothes  no thermostat for heat or cool.

review.title: Nice and quiet
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service...great cafe attached to hotel

review.title: Rude and uniformed staff, lies about breakfast
review.reviewText: terrible, the room was pretty much like motel 6, the staff had no quarters for the laundry and they lied and said we could use the Hilton next door for pool.
review.negativeRemarks: staff are immature and rude, terrible. Especially Victor, very insulting person.

review.title: Nice view
review.reviewText: Hotel was easy to find and was greeted by friendly staff. There is a restaurant right next to it that is open 24 hours and has good food. The view was nice, get the highest floor possible! The room was clean but could have used more vacuuming. The key card would not work and we got replacement ones although we heard other guest complain about their keys also so not sure what was going on. Great place to stay for a reasonable price.

review.title: Don't stay
review.reviewText: Never again we will stay in this facility unless you are ready to stay  awake all night
It was far from the city but great for the price. Very updated and clean.

I did stay at this hotel for one night but it was very difficult to sleep because in this hotel all room doors didn't protect from any street noise and from anything what's happened outside. You definitely need earplugs !!! if you want to sleep. Other than that , it's 2-3 star hotel, surprisingly clean room and towels.
review.negativeRemarks: Some sort of noise insulation for doors.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, super nice restaurant for breakfast !

review.reviewText: Dirty floor not swept, room just felt dirty. Never again.
Lots of noise construction all day.. It was not a 3 star..

Card key did not work and I needed to go to front again.
Night light on the wall was broken and hunging to pillow area. It was dangerous. 
When I reported to front desk, sounds like they knew that.
Finally, they changed my room.

review.title: Family feeling
review.reviewText: Everything was top notch but the staff was over the moon helpful, courteous, caring as though we were their own family members.  The food from the restaurant was excellent and they too bent over backwards to accommodate our late arrive and early departure needs due to connecting schedules for on-going transportation.  The shuttle from-to the airport was a god-sent blessing.  I will definitely stay there anytime I visit San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and food could not be better!
review.negativeRemarks: The weather but they aren't responsible for that.

review.reviewText: Very low water pressure in shower. Felt spings in bed. Tv not working properly.

review.title: Good access to SFO airport
review.reviewText: Only one night stay for transfer from an international flight to a domestic one. So just relax at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Good access to the SFO airport with a convenient bus shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: near the SFO airport

review.title: Loud and noisy.
review.reviewText: Planes and trains all night long. Loud plumbing. Everytime somebody flushes a toilet or runs water it sounds like it's right by your head. Staff was clueless. They had lobby entrance blocked off due to some sidewalk repairs. That's ok because you have to fix issues at some point, but had to enter through inside lobby door where they decided to start mopping floor at 5:30 during high traffic check in time. Then they tell me I need to wait outside. So I got annoyed and had to ask them "how do I check into my room?". Their response was "OH, you want to check in?" DUH!
Better than expected, clean comfortable and convenient.

I definitely regretted staying here. I would have paid a little more to stay at Hilton or elsewhere. The first room we got was horrible. The heater was broken and the telephone line wasn't even plugged in so we couldn't call the front desk from that phone. Luckily, they switched us to another room, which had a working heater and telephone line. The internet connection is terrible though. And the room itself was not that clean. I don't think they mop the floors because it was stained and there was gunk stuck to the floor. The sheets we were given had holes in them and were also stained. The only good thing about this place was the good and prompt and friendly service.

review.title: OK Hotel, but a little disappointing.
review.reviewText: On a cold night, 47 degrees, the blankets were like bedsheets not blankets.  The toilet was not working properly, you had to jiggle the handle or the water would continue to flow.  There was no safety handles in the bathtub.  Toilet tissue was of poor quality.  We were on the ground floor and we could hear people coming and going and even hear people's conversation as they passed the room.
review.positiveRemarks:
1.  It was close to the SF airport.  
2.  It had shuttle service to the SF airport.
3.  It had a nice restaurant off the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks:
1.  Install safety bars in the shower.  
2.  Have warm blankets on the bed.
3.  Upgrade personal-use supplies, i.e. toilet paper.

review.title: Nice hotel - close to SF
review.reviewText: Good stay.  Appreciated closeness to SF attractions.

review.title: Near the airport. Reasonably priced.
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff. Heater hard to regulate. Had to ask for enough towels.

review.title: Heather broke
review.reviewText: We check in at 11.30 kids go straight to the bed, heather was broke, we call reception and they can fix it. toilet  was with out cover top. Theycan run a business like that. Staff offers a new room but at 2.00am with kidsyoucan do it

review.title: Close to Bart walking along water restaurant 24 hr
review.reviewText: Water not very hot.    Great clean room. Shuttle service much to do around

They wanted to charge me twice I guess because they couldn't tell I paid it all online. When I walked to the lobby I stood there for a minute without a word just waiting for the staff to notice I was there trying to check in

review.title: Average hotel.
review.reviewText: Wifi was no good inside the room. Awesome outside if you stay in your car. The diner was a plus. No breakfast. Not even continental.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, clean room . They come everyday to tidy your room, put more staff that you need . They really care about their guest.

review.title: Nice clean place to stay near airport.
review.reviewText: Rooms were ready immediately at checkin. Rooms seemed to have been very recently upgraded. Clean, new furniture, fixtures. Small refrigerator and microwave were a nice surprise. Reasonable rates considering the close proximity to airport. Would happily stay there again.
Awesome. Appreciated the twenty four hour shuttle.
Conveniently close to airport, helpful staff, but run-down and not very clean

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Located near SFO and right by the seaside trail. Convinient parking (with a fee) and 24 hour cafe.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location and 24 hour food and drink.
Got help by staff with packing tape and so on.
review.negativeRemarks: Too strong detergent smell in the room. Even my eyes were hurt first moved in.

review.title: Very nice, Very convenient
review.reviewText: I love this place.  It's my go-to for SFO.  Rooms are affordable, although they have recently begun charging 10 buck a night for parking...didn't like that.  However, probably the most inexpensive place for park n fly possible at only 10 a night.  The rooms are very clean and comfortable, even if the outside might seem a tiny bit shabby around elevators, etc.  If you happen to have time for a walk, it is gorgeous along the waterside trail. There is a restaurant as well for convenience.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the rate as well as the location.  Staff were very cordial.
review.negativeRemarks: Sidewalks and outdoor hallways a bit shabby.  Could probably do some cleaning and pressure washing around there and elevators...

review.title: very good place
review.reviewText: Everything was fine we enjoy our stay at this hotel...... Thx

review.title: Loud and scary
review.reviewText:
Made a reservation for 3 star hotel in Burlingame with Expedia without knowing name of hotel.
Arrived after 10 pm. The walk to my room at the end of the building was badly lighted and full of boxes in my way. I did not feel safe here. Elevator smelled like an ashtray.
Gaps between door and frame. Very loud air conditioner, but I could still hear traffic and plane noise.
Can not understand why Expedia pushes a hotel like this for 3 stars!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Would return!
review.reviewText: Very hospitable! Comfortable, close to airport and the bay. 👍🏻😊👍🏼

review.title: Scary at Night
review.reviewText: We arrived late at night and were directed to the last building down and  to the 3rd floor.  The corridors were cement blocks that led to the right parking lots and left parking lots.  We found the elevator.  The elevator is old but worked. I didn't feel safe in this place at night.  It was different during the day but I could not recommend it to anyone because of this.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was pleasant and helpful and a good breakfast spot attached to the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: We only took the shuttle back and forth to the airport.

review.title: Below average hotel but very close to the airport.
review.reviewText: The rooms were not well insulated from noise.  We could hear noise from the street and neighboring rooms.  With our original neighboring room, we could hear the occupants selling "items" from it.  We requested a new room because of the high volume of activity next door.  In the second room (on the other side of the building) the bathroom sink had permanent stains in the sink, which made it look dirty.  The heater/a/c unit did not work well and was very noisy.

Perfect place to stay if you are flying out of San Francisco International. There is an all night restaurant on the property with great food. The hotel provides a shuttle to the airport. It is less expensive than many of the other hotels but just as nice, making it a bargain.

review.title: For $300 a night, I was not expecting motel 6
review.reviewText: Insanely overpriced for a motel 6 experience. Felt unsafe, gangsters sitting outside my door all night, area felt risky. Room was dingy and grungy looking. Key cards kept deactivating (4 times). If it was $75 a night, I would be fine with it, but for $300 it's an incredible insult.

review.title: Near the airport
review.reviewText: ... But that's about it. Rooms are not clean and incredibly noisy. I would only go back if I am absolutely desperate.
As i rated overal was okay but parking lot was too narrow and when i got in the room the door was open for whatever no reason but they changed for me at the end.

review.title: Worst hotel for the year
review.reviewText: It was the worst hotel I stayed in 2015.  At first they gave a room key for a room in which somebody was already staying.  The next room was on the ground floor with contractors drinking and making food in front of the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Management was very bad

review.title: we were robbed during check in!
review.reviewText: our rental car was broken into and robbed during the 10 minutes we were checking into this airport hotel. that hotel of course takes no responsibility. we were told by the police that they have a history of break ins there. don't stay here unless you are super security conscious.
review.negativeRemarks: security in the parking lot

review.title: Solid affordable choice
review.reviewText: For those coming for work, it is a low cost, pragmatic alternative to the much more expensive offerings. It is close to other hotels with restaurants and bars, some even offer free shuttles to downtown burlingame.

review.title: Just a motel
review.reviewText: Just like a motel, but with Weak wifi if you close the door. Bugs in the room. Extra parking fee no breakfast.Won't choose it next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Too many

review.title: Trains, Planes and Automobiles
review.reviewText:
Bring your ear plugs because the room is not well insulated from outside noise and you have Highway 101, CalTrains and the aircraft at SFO to contend with.  This may also apply to other hotels in this area of Burlingame.  However, the windows/door could have been better insulated.  The room was clean, but the toilet was broke. 

I don't recall Expedia pointing out during the booking process that an additional $10/night parking fee applies.  Minimal toiletries are supplied.
review.negativeRemarks: Better insulation to outside noise.  Ear plugs are highly recommended.

review.title: New Furniture
review.reviewText: We were put in a freshly remodeled room,so it was very nice. but the AC sounded like it was going to take off, sleeping was difficult for my boyfriend.
review.negativeRemarks: the AC unit need to be fixed or replaced
review.locationRemarks: the attached diner was good, but any other food is a drive. so if you will need a car to find other options.

review.reviewText: The employees here are really nice and helped us with directions. We didn't have a refrigerator in our room. The shower drained really slowly. Walls are super thin and you can hear everything your neighbor does.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to where we needed to be and the hotel staff did what they could to accommodate our needs.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good and about a 20 minute drive to San Fran to go into the city and do things.

review.title: Did not have a nice stay.
review.reviewText: We were given a handicap room . Mirror too low sink too low shower hand spray did not work wood bench in tub shelf fell off wall air cond very loud recycled off and on every 10 min tryed to turn it up or down did the same thing. They ran out of coffee in the morning took too long to make more. Plenty of parking but still charged to park. Fridge also noisey all nite.

review.title: Ok for a night or two
review.reviewText: Clean rooms and hotel, rooms had good facilities but one of the rooms we stayed in had no hairdryer, free shuttle to the airport for onward transit but far from the city centre so commuting to the centre would be expensive, friendly staff and a pleasant diner open 24 hours. May stay here again for a nights stopover but could hear through the walls and too far from city centre for a longer stay.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText:
The toilet in my room had no handle and the shower sounded as if were going to explode.
My husband didn't want to shower for fear of waking the entire hotel.

review.title: Noisy moldy dirty
review.reviewText: Got no sleep   People next door were awfully loud through r night. Never stay there again

review.title: Good hotel near the SFO!
review.reviewText: This hotel does not offer any breakfast. Has coffee at the lobby. Has a 24hour diner in front of the building. Has comfy bed and clean room. Have a nice swimming pool but never had a chance to use it.
review.negativeRemarks: A an extra roll of tissue in the bathroom.

review.title: Bare bones, simple and clean
review.reviewText: Very simple room, minimal decor surrounded by hotels of a much better caliber. Clean room, friendly staff but certainly not a 3 star experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room and acceptable bed. Good shower. Nice sized television.
review.negativeRemarks: A real blanket on the beds. Add late check out. Storage for luggage until flight. Shuttle to SFO more frequent.Continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Free trolley into town of Burlingame stopped next door. 24 hour diner type restaurant adjacent to building. Tourist flyers well stocked in lobby.

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: The air conditioner is on one side of the room so that side gets too cold in order to have the entire unit cooled. It's also a very loud air conditioner. There was some baseboard that had been knocked off before we arrived and no one had bothered to have it repaired.
review.negativeRemarks: Room needs an refresh; healthy food options in the cafe needed.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: It was fine, but don't expect much more than that.
review.reviewText:
Staying at the airport, my expectations coming in weren't too high from the get go. We waited at the airport for over an hour for the hotel shuttle to pick us up. The two younger guys at the hotel desk were friendly and helpful, but the two older guys were completely miserable. 

The room was fairly clean, but there was some sort of bug or beetle in my bed. And, the worst part of all was the water situation. When turning the shower on, it would make an extremely loud noise and there was literally no water pressure. You'd have to pool water in the tub to wash out your hair- it was horrible. I told the front desk about it, and they just said "ok"... not even "thanks".

I was brave enough to go swimming in the heated outdoor pool, but trust me, it was not clean. Too bad I couldn't shower after.

Would I stay here again? If the price was right and if I absolutely had to, yes. But, I'd recommend checking out other airport area hotels first.
review.positiveRemarks: I guess I'd have to say the location was pretty good. There's not much in the area to do or even grab a coffee, but its nice being near the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure/noise. The friendliness of the older gents at the front desk. The cleanliness of the room.
review.locationRemarks: Really nothing to do at all. There was a diner attached to the hotel, but it was closed the majority of the time we were there.

review.title: We were close to the SF airportr
review.reviewText:
We were not there very long .  restaurant handy and good.  landscaping nice, painting 
okay but what is badly needed is power washing the cement in the whole place.
too much gum and soot on cement.  cleaning would upgrade the place as the
rooms are not fancy but nice.  employees are nice and helpful;
review.positiveRemarks: having a restaurant next to it that is good, could use a fresh up look tho.
review.negativeRemarks: cement walkways badly need either sandblasting or power washing.
review.locationRemarks: proximity to SF airport only advantage

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Speedy check in and check out. Excellent customer service.

Overall, the hotel was fine.  The airport location was important and we had easy access to the airport.  The staff was good, provided directions and locations for dining, and airport shuttle information.  I am not sure it's a 3 star hotel, though it's more than 2 stars.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff members and easy airport access/shuttle.

review.title: Hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Hotel close to the airport. Very convenient. Reasonably priced.  Good service.  Thank you.

review.title: Overpriced hotel stay
review.reviewText:
The Red Roof Inn has newly renovated rooms, but the  bedspreads were crumbled, the chair was stained, the room key cards did not work and had to be replaced twice. There was no way to hang up your clothes, since the refrigerator, microwave and safe were placed under the clothes rack with little clearance for clothes.
There was a charge for parking even so we paid an OUTRAGEOPUSLY HIGH price for the room.
review.positiveRemarks: The convenience to the San Francisco Airport and the shuttle to the airport
review.negativeRemarks:
The placement of the refrigerator, microwave and safe away from under the clothes rack.
Clean bedspreads and chair
review.locationRemarks:
Near San Francisco Airport
Great restaurant "Kincaids" near by.

review.title: Close tout airport
review.reviewText:
Staff minimalist. some are agressive.
Accoustic isolation from room tout room non existent.
The services are excellent especially the free shuttle is very convenient. But the lobby looks old and so with the restroom. no free breakfast available.

review.title: Close to sf airport
review.reviewText: General condition of hotel is a little rundown. It needs a little " shine". Walkways are like alleys, with smelly cigarette disposal containers.
review.negativeRemarks: Repainting

review.reviewText: Room is not big, however is quiet. they don't offer continental breakfast. The cafe attached to this inn is not good.

Even though it is a older hotel, it is well maintained and clean.  Couldn't ask for such a quality room for the price.  Pool facilities were clean and nice.  Having a restaurant attached made it convenient with good food for a fair price.  We will stay there again, and would recommend it to anyone traveling on a budget.

review.title: A place to sleep by the airport
review.reviewText: Bath room could have been a lot cleaner. Outside of Bldg needs to be pressure washed. I was told that the 3rd. Floor room had a nice view of the lagoon. How ever she neglected to tell me yo need to come out of the room and look around a wall.. Ops.

review.title: Needs cleaning. Very noisy. $10 extra to park.
review.reviewText: Had to pay an extra $10 a night to park on their grounds. Was not disclosed when booking. Couldn't print airline tickets out. Their printer was out of order. From the looks of the sign, it has been out of order for quite some time. Okay place if you want a basic room but not if you want kleenex, privacy or quiet. Quite worn facility.
review.negativeRemarks: Just about everything.
review.locationRemarks: Six minutes from San Francisco Airport.

review.title: A nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: We stayed one night and enjoyed our stay. The price was reasonable and restaurant was a plus. We would definitely recommend it to others.

review.title: Only stayed 1 night.
review.reviewText: Hotel is good if you need something close to the airport. Free shuttle was nice. I would chose another hotel if staying in San Fean longer.

review.title: Shuttle is convenient
review.reviewText: Stayed here in tail end of a business trip...not much around the hotel within walking distance.  No snacks..soda vending machines only accept credit or atm cards...getting back to san fran is a hotel shuttle to SFO amd then 25 min ride on BART train to embarcadero station...shuttle from hotel to SFO run every 30 mins.  Hotel is dated...rooms are very old and would benefit of new makeovers...stucko on ceilings and walls...

review.title: Adequate, but not great.
review.reviewText: Celebrating anniversary.  Three-night stay. Fortunately, we were able to book an all-day tour, where the shuttle picked us up.  Otherwise, a very long drive to San Francisco on unfamiliar route.  Ate at adjacent LeAnn's Cafe.  Breakfast was great---dinner was awful, awful.
review.positiveRemarks: It seems to be in a safe area, and it is lovely to be able to walk across the street to walk along the water.  Lovely.
review.negativeRemarks: Too pricey. Surprised by $10 per day parking fee for almost-empty parking lot, and a fee for use of safe, that you have to request to get subtracted.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown Burlingame is lovely and clean, with nice stores and restaurants.  Hotel is very close to train and BART stations.

review.reviewText: Nothing special, but everything was fine. I don't have anything more to add, stupid if you want me to rate this hotel to make me do this.

Dirty, staff ignored me for a few minutes when I was trying to check in. Asked for a room on the ground floor,was told I would like a higher floor better. Not satisfied at all. I will never stay here again.

review.title: What is it with airport hotels?
review.reviewText: We arrived late from the east coast so we stayed at an airport hotel. Why are they so overpriced? This was fairly reasonably priced but the place was just OK - have stayed at much nicer for the price, but of course, not at an airport. Room was clean but looked like a rehab of an old hotel. Room smelled when we got there, but the air conditioner worked very well and quickly removed the smell. Bed was just OK - most hotel beds are pretty good now, but this felt like a large piece of foam. Got there at 1:00 AM and left by 8:00 AM.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location - air conditioner worked well.

review.title: Very shabby
review.reviewText: Hotel is smelly and grubby looking. The bed is very hard making sleep difficult. Very noisy as walls very thin especially if in a room with a through door to the next room. Fixtures broken in the bathroom and mould underneath the silicone joins. Would only recommend if no other hotel available.
review.positiveRemarks: Quick check in and out plus airport shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: Everything - needs to be completely refurbished.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport and no facilities nearby.

review.reviewText: the hotel was easy to find, easy to check in and didn't offer any draw backs... perfect for anybody that just needs a place to crash while hanging out in SF

review.title: Terrible! Bed bug
review.reviewText: This hotel is not clean, have bed bug in the room.

review.title: terrible！ bed bug！！
review.reviewText: stay this hotel 4 night, one day wake up with lots of red spot (rush) on my body, first I thought it's allergy, came back home check with doctor, doctor said it is bite!!

review.title: Independent hotel living
review.reviewText: The rooms are nice. The pool is warm and clean. The beds are a little hard and blankets are very flat and heavy. First floor does not have microwaves or refrigerators but you may ask them to bring them. The laundry was broken but at least they try to have that amenity. The restaurant food was Farley poor but at least they have one. The shuttles were never on time and sometimes 2 came at once every hour instead of every 30 min. But if they worked out these bugs it would be an ideal place to stay.

review.title: Worst Hotel Ever
review.reviewText: I arrived late at night and needed a place close to the San Francisco airport to stay until the next day.  The sheets had a stain on it.  Early in the morning, I can hear the people next door talking as if they are in the same room since the floor is wood flooring instead of carpet.  Super loud and annoying, I couldn't sleep anymore, so I turned on the TV and it doesn't work properly, the TV kept scanning from channel to channel.  I decided that I'm leaving early even though I barely got any rest, take a shower and as I'm blow drying my hair for a couple minutes, the fire alarm goes off.  It's beeping so LOUD that I panic as I thought the whole place was going off while it was just my room because of the warm air from the hair blow dryer.  Horrible!!! Just absolutely horrible!!  As I checked out, the lady didn't even ask about my stay, so I told her that this is the "worst" hotel I have ever stayed in, and she was making excuses that's first floor, etc.... Regardless I never write reviews but this place is not a 3-star hotel, it doesn't deserve a star at all.  Don't waste your money here.

review.title: OK accommodations
review.reviewText: The day we checked in, 10min after we got our luggage into our room, someone else tried to get in the room. I think it was a housekeeper. Once we unlocked the cross bar lock, she came in & pulled a sweatshirt out of the dresser door. After she left we found a wet towel on the back of the bathroom door, & it appeared the floor around the toilet was wet. Later, we determined the wet floor was coming from a leak around the toilet seal. It was a little surprising that the room, was being used by a employee, even more surprising that without knocking tried to enter the room with a key, regardless of it being occupied.

review.title: Small beds
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, very nice food at the restaurant on site but very small beds for two people.

review.title: Near the airport
review.reviewText: The wifi in our room didn't work and we were told we had to call another company to fix it. After two calls, and two techs saying it was fine though there was no service, I told the clerk who said there was nothing that could be done about it. For 6 days I had to go to the lobby and use the service from there. I am a writer who does a lot of research, and this made it very difficult.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very close to the airport and the bay, to be able to walk. The restaurant on the property (though not connected to the hotel) was wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: The service to the customers.
review.locationRemarks: It is a good location. So close to the airport and the bay. Not far from San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the airport
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet hotel close to the airport with a free shuttle running half hourly. Staff were courteous and helpful. Ate at the Hilton across the road, meal was adequate.
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do but hotel has a pool.

review.title: Really helpful staff
review.reviewText: Great pool, handy laundry and really helpful staff

review.title: This is not a three or 3 1/2 star hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel room was not that nice. It was small and seemed like it had been remodeled from a past hotel.    It had a lot of amenities which was nice, but staying in the room felt uncomfortable.   The beds were not very comfortable and the overall feel of the room felt unclean. The bathroom was tiny and again the room was small.   The driver for the shuttle was unfriendly and the night clerk also seemed to dislike  connecting with the guests.   The room said it had free Wi-Fi, but there was no signal available in our room.

review.title: Airport Shuttle
review.reviewText: We were only there 10 hours because we needed a place with a free shuttle to the airport at 4 a.m.  The service was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the convenience to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: I was not there long enough to suggest any specific improvements.
review.locationRemarks: There is not much to do in the immediate area but a free shuttle is available that takes visitors to nearby shops and restaurants.

review.title: Adequate for 1 night
review.reviewText:
We stayed 1 night to be close to the airport. Shuttle service was good, although we got to the lobby at 4:05 am for a 4:24 shuttle and it was already loading- was gone by 4:10 or so. Get there early to get a seat!
Room was OK, but lots of noise with vehicles coming and going most of the night.
Expensive for the quality, but everything in SF is.
review.positiveRemarks:
Free airport shuttle.
Close to airport.
review.negativeRemarks:
Beds were small for 2 people.
Noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do in immediate area. There is a 24 hour restaurant attached to the hotel that was very busy and had good food.

review.title: Dirty, overpriced.
review.reviewText: My room was dirty. Floor was sticky. Empty shampoo bottles. Iron had black sticky mess on it, making it unusable. Expensive parking (give me a permit, but it is unnecessary to charge extra for it).

review.title: I don't recommend this hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel makes me disappointed. I asked for a non-smoke room, but the room still has the strong smoke smells. The bathroom is tiny with the noisy fan. I asked the house keeping, but no answer from the customer service. So I don't recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Room

review.reviewText: The rooms are to small there's no closet and no carpet. Over all when we left our beds were not made ect. We didn't have any space. That's why I checked out early!

review.title: Good value, easy access!
review.reviewText: Close to the airport, easy access, very friendly staff, decent rooms! Checking in and out was a breeze!
review.negativeRemarks: nicer shower and maybe bathtub
review.locationRemarks: there is a restaurant on premises, very good hamburgers and Chinese food!

review.title: Great hotel, staff and location!
review.reviewText: Very convenient and affordable! We stayed in several places during our trip and this was a nice place to wrap it up. You can't hear airport noise...and it has a 24hr cafe. Billingame also has a CUTE street (Broadway) that has tons of restaurants and shops! We enjoyed it here!

review.title: OK hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: The stuff didn't explain where to wait for the shuttle bus correctly.  I didn't feel warm welcome from the stuff when I did check in.
review.negativeRemarks: Educate the stuff.

review.title: nice hotel, close to airport.
review.reviewText: rooms cleanliness, comfortable bed(king), attaching restaurant a ++

review.title: Spent one night there because it was close to SFO
review.reviewText: Basic hotel.  No frills. Staff helpful. There is a very good cafe immediately next to hotel. Shuttle service very efficient.
review.positiveRemarks: Cafe essentially attached and prompt shuttle service to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Could use some updating in decor.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport.

review.title: Nice stop after a NYC SFO flight
review.reviewText: Location and price are what drew me to this hotel needed a place to rest before a long drive. This hotel was perfect for that.
review.locationRemarks: 24 hour Restaurant perfect for a quick bit before turning in for the evening.

review.title: Nice Hotel.. for cheaper price
review.reviewText: Need a quik place to rest and found this on Expedia.com.. Room were clean and had WIFI internet and had a flat screen TV,  Freezer, Study Desk station and Microwave with a Safety Safe box in the room.. Enough of what I needed for a over night stay..
review.positiveRemarks: All the things need in the room except a kitchen
review.negativeRemarks: Blankets needs upgrading
review.locationRemarks: Dinning in same office building and Nothing really close except driving distance but close to great walking view of the ocean side Airpport

review.title: Average hotel in quiet area.
review.reviewText:
The room we had was disappointing in that at sometime the plaster had fallen off the ceiling in large chunks and the walls in the bathroom were water damaged, skirting had pulled away from the wall base because the shower curtain did not keep water from splashing out and over time had swollen the wallboard. 
The furnishings were fine and the room was reasonably quiet even though it was alongside a busy road. The bed was very comfortable and the Aircon was quiet for an American hotel.
The attached 24hr restaurant was, luckily,very good because there are no grocery or convenience stores within 3 miles and we had flown in and out of San Francisco and were without a car. That made the room microwave a useless item.
review.positiveRemarks: The quiet area with some footpaths in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: The room needed upgrading.
review.locationRemarks: The only thing to do without a car was to walk along the foreshore and watch the aircraft coming and going.

review.title: The staff for the hotel and 24 hour cafe where gre
review.reviewText: A nice hotel close to SFO! Pool was dirty but other than that room was clean and beds were actually comfortable!

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText:
Pro: We only stayed for a night. The hotel staff was super friendly, prompt, courteous, went above and beyond to make sure we were happy :) I'm huge on service and loved the fact that they are as well. 

Con: However, the hotel is set up like a motel- each hotel room door is visible from the parking area. My sisters and I felt "exposed", given that we're used to staying at hotel's. 

MAJOR CON: The absolute worst (and scariest) part of the stay happened after we woke up the next morning- someone was at our door and tried to get into our room!! We checked the peephole and saw a tall man wearing a sweater (obviously not hotel staff). He tried the door a few times and eventually gave up and walked away. Thankfully we had the dead bolt on but the experience was enough to rattle us :/

review.title: Yuck.
review.reviewText: The room was tiny and the outside door had a gap from the floor about an inch high. The room was quite dirty and the beds were very uncomfortable, and the price was insanely high for the quality. The staff was clearly more interested in seeing the tour busses that flooded into the hotel than dealing with individual families. Poor experience.

review.title: Close to airport. Good hotel for quick stay
review.reviewText: Good for an overnight stay. Easy access to freeway
They did not honor the the price of reservation, I have to argue with the Manager.

review.title: Very convenient to San Francisco airport.
review.reviewText: Very close to San Francisco airport with convenient shuttle bus. Restaurant in hotel.

review.title: Yikes
review.reviewText: Roach in our hotel room! Needless to say we will not be back.

review.title: Good location near the airport, great restaurant
review.reviewText: Nothing fancy, pretty old building, but clean and adequate. The staff is nice and very helpful. Next to the Doubletree which has a trolley to downtown Burlingame and Caltrain station. The best thing about the place is LeeAnn's restaurant, which is open 24 hours and has great, affordable food and excellent, fast service.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame trolley to shopping and restaurants

review.title: nice motel
review.reviewText: very well located ,10' from SFO airport,and 30'' from rte 101 that leads to SFO.nice surroudings ocean and side walk;
review.positiveRemarks: it has a pool,and very well locatedin a quiet setting
review.negativeRemarks: tell the costumer that he has to;pay $10/night for the parking of the car,that is not specified in the brochure of the motel;
review.locationRemarks: very well location ,for it is 10' from ,the SFO.

review.title: Just right
review.reviewText: Convenient to dining, walking, Payless and airport
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet in 1st room was broken (room shouldn't have been sold), but manager moved us to another room quickly with apology.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants in big (expensive) hotels nearby, walking trails along SF Bay.

review.reviewText: We stayed two nights for doctor appointments. Rooms are small and the two beds are too. It's kept clean and in a great location.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I've always found this hotel to be a perfect resting spot between flights in SFO.  This time I had to stay for more than a night and found it difficult to reserve a room for the desired stay, so I booked (4) separate reservations: (2) expedia and (2) red roof.com.  The rooms were clean EXCEPT for the last room I stayed in where there was an opened condom packet in the night stand next to the bed - YUCK!

Room is small bathroom is huge.first floor noise at night shuttles ever 30 mins on time 

My room didn't have microwave and fridge but I was able to use employee kitchen

review.title: Convenient, close to the airport that includes shu
review.reviewText: Overall experience I would say is okay. Although it was very loud, it seems that you can hear when the room beside you was taking a shower. Our room for some reason did not have a blower/exhaust in the washroom which made it foggy and had to open to the main room to get some air out.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide wifi in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: Only the beachwalk was the only thing to do nearby. Other than the coffee shops or restaurants, you'd have to take a cab to get around.

review.title: The worst hotel I ever stayed.
review.reviewText: The room is old, the blanket is not clean, I can even see a yellowish stain on it. The room smells cigarette. I turned on the air condition, it is so loud, you need to turn it off to talk in the room or sleep. The bath tub does not drain well, it is just not comfortable to use the shower. They offer free Wi-Fi, it is just way too slow, the front desk staff are not friendly and not efficient. You can tell they are not happy there. You waited in line, only one staff is working, the rest of the staff just sit there unless you asked for help. I travel a lot, either for business trip or vacation. It is just a terrible experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The worst hotel I ever stayed.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Nothing. The only thing is close to San Francisco airport, you need a car to go anywhere.

review.title: Too expensive, not well maintained
review.reviewText: Definitely don't recommend this hotel if you're looking at getting a decent quality room. The floors were bumped, the bathtub didn't drain properly and was dirty, and WiFi didn't work. I complained about the WiFi and the lady that attended me couldn't care less, she gave me some number to call, and after 30 min on the phone with the tech they didn't do anything to fix it.

review.title: Economical Stay in SFO
review.reviewText: We stayed @ Red Roof Inn during our short trip to SFO. Room was good with a comfortbale bed and Air conditioner, TV had full channels list, there was facility to subscribe new movies, The Free wifi  had a  weak signal in our room.  They provide coffee maker, Iron box, hair dryer, spacious bathrooom. Our room in the down stair noisy with outside noise of car and people speaking  disturbing the week hours at 1am.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi signal is not enough. rooms in downstairs did not seal the outside noise. Please provide  sound proof  doors, windows.
review.locationRemarks: There is a 24 hours Chinese restaurant nearby. Hotel provides Airport shuttle round the click providing easy transit to travellers without car.

review.title: Not too shabby.
review.reviewText: Overall, it was above average for a motel room.  The connected 24 hour diner was a favorite for our group.  It was clean, and well managed.
review.positiveRemarks: It was conveniently located, and the diner was really nice to have around.
review.negativeRemarks: I wasn't too thrilled by the price, since we also stayed at a nicer hotel nearby for just $30 more per night later in the week; however, it suited our
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport and other hotels.  Close to the bay.  30 minutes to either San Francisco or San Jose.  The area was pretty nice.

review.title: NICE HOTEL
review.reviewText: GOOD PLACE FOR STAY, PRICE IS GOOD COMPARE WITH OTHER HOTEL NEAR BY

review.title: Dirty room
review.reviewText:
The room had filthy floors and paint on chairs. There was a constant smell in the room and loud noise every time the guest above used their water.

The staff were good but let down by the facility.

review.title: Hotel high cost for motel level quality
review.reviewText:
overpriced.  Felt like motel. Their printer was broken so didn't get receipt. Took a while to check in because they had computer issues. 

Our flight was moved by airline to next day. They made us cancel our reservation and book again @ extremely highly rate. Not flexible and staff not helpful.

review.title: Good place to stay for any business use
review.reviewText: It's as good as it gets as a business hotel where you have anything you might need to conduct a good business outing.  It certainly isn't convenient for any San Francisco vicinity pleasure visits, but the proximity to airports and trains, as well as whatever you need to do in the close vicinity, it is fine and staff is more than happy to assist.

review.title: severely mildewed bathroom
review.reviewText: We arrived late Sunday night. The bathroom door in our room was closed. The next morning when I went in the bathroom, it wreaked of mildew. I told the young people running the hotel and they said there was nothing they could do. We had to skip showers, and I had to find a salon on a holiday to wash and blow out my hair, which ended up costing us an extra $60. Our room had not been updated in decades.

review.title: Very nice in an expensive area
review.reviewText: All was well, no complaints. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel, Leanne, had the best food and customer service.

review.title: close to the airport and NOT noisy from planes
review.reviewText:
We had a nice non smoking second floor room and it was most comfortable for us to stay for only one night.
The room was attractive and the hot water for the shower was just right.  I can Not find anything to write negative about my short time spent at the hotel. I WOULD go again if the chance presents itself.  Thank you
review.negativeRemarks: Am not a real fussy person and do not know of a thing, but am sure if my stay  had been longer I could at least come up with one thing.
review.locationRemarks: You would have to figure that out for your self, as I stated I was ONLY there for ONE night so I have no idea.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Check in was quick and simple. Room was cleaned but lack of air freshener etc in the bathroom. Decent for a hotel that is close to the airport.
Only stayed one night but suited our needs...clean, 24 hour restaurant, nice view and close to the airport

review.title: Close to the airport, cafe, but loud
review.reviewText: I am a frequent business traveler to the SFO area and my room for this trip was on the first floor as the room type I booked was only available on that floor (said to me when I checked in). The room was NOT private at all. In fact, on three different occasions, other guests stopped and peered into my room, making for an awkward moment. I have stayed at this hotel in the past and if you can get on an upper floor, it is very comfortable and private. My room was also handicap accessible which had its own peculiarities including no place to put my toiletries in the bathroom.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is close to the airport and offers a shuttle. Additionally, there is a free trolley to downtown Burlingame to explore the local fare
review.negativeRemarks: I would recommend putting another sheer shade on the first floor rooms for privacy.
review.locationRemarks: The free trolley can take you to downtown Burlingame where there are a variety of food options and shops. There is also a nice local candy shop.

review.title: Stay Away!
review.reviewText: Overpriced, dingy, not what one would expect for so much money…Embassy Suites-class money for a trailer-park experience. Concrete block walls, dirty, bed pillows that doubled for upholstered bricks. Asked for more pillows; they didn't have any extras! Really?!
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the place up…get some decent staff…get some decent bed linens and pillows

review.title: Convenient airport hotel by the bay shore
review.reviewText: Overall a nice hotel and pleasant sta close to the airport. A couple odd issues like a dirty pink rag was left in my room 2 nights in a row. I  came back to the room to find the bath tub was also strangely filled with water 1 day. Otherwise a pleasant place to stay for 3 nights, comfortable bed, nice room decor. Outlets easily accessible by nightstand and desk, which is something I've found annoyingly missing from larger hotels. Nice 24hr diner linked to hotel and free Burlingame shuttle just across the street at Doubletree. Red Roof also has a free airport shuttle but it only runs twice an hour. Very nice walking/running path along the bay shore nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, modern room decor, 24hr diner connected, pool available, free water bottle. Shuttle to airport to connect with BART transportation.
review.locationRemarks: A free shuttle to downtown Burlingame and other hotels across the street at the Doubletree hotel. Located near a very nice shore path. 24 hr diner.

review.title: Hotel staff
review.reviewText: At time of checking in hotel staff 3 ladies and a guy all working there kept making jokes and flirting with each other. 10 minutes later this lady helped me checking in but didn't charge me for parking..so I went back to get parking permit..she then charges me twice for the room $97and $20 for parking..then she said the $97 was just a pending charge it should credit back to account..but it didn't..I don't know why I hot charged in the first place.. Even that front desk lady didn't know how to answer my question.. She kept saying because she slide my credit card..huh!,,really bad customer service..I have been staying at red roof all the time ..but its time to pick another hotel.the only reason they are busy is because of tourist not locals.
This hotel was ok, but when I booked it on Expedia it was listed as a 3 star hotel.  It is not a 3 star hotel.

review.title: Try Somewhere Else
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for one night as I had an early flight out of SFO.  When I got there to check in, they had a line out the door and one, very confused, hotel clerk trying to check everyone in.  He was moving at the speed of a snail and it seemed like he had no idea what he was doing.  When I finally got checked in after waiting in line for almost an hour, I went to my room and the first key I tried didn't work.  The second one thankfully did, so I didn't have to go back to the front desk.  I got settled in and then went looking for the ice machine.  I found one on the first floor and it was out of order, but had no sign advising so.  I walked back to the front lobby and now there were two clerks, none of with acknowledged my presence.  I waited for 5 minutes to ask where a working ice machine was and they never even looked at me.  I checked 3 different floors and finally found a working machine.  Later, I tried to get some water out of the vending machine, which was also broken.  I also called the front desk to schedule a wake up call and it rang for about 5 minutes before I gave up and hung up.  I would never stay at this hotel again based on the service and how many things did not work.  However, the room was pretty clean and the bed was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing I liked about this hotel was the bed.  Everything else needs improvement.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service needs an improvement.  Ice machines should be in working order.  Vending machines should be in working order.
review.locationRemarks: There isn't much to do near this hotel.  You have to drive about 5-10 miles away to get to any restaurants or stores.

review.title: OK for what it is.
review.reviewText: A convenient place to stay after a cross-country trip, arriving late at night.  Relatively quiet and comfortable.  But not as clean as we would have liked- mold around base of shower and stuffy smell when we arrived.

review.title: Convenient
