review.reviewText: Tiny room without any frills; not even a box of Kleenex. It was, however, clean and convenient and cheaper than a SF hotel.

review.title: OK Hotel, incompetent staff
review.reviewText: We bought and paid for rooms 2 weeks before the stay.  When we came to check in, which was in the evening, it took them 30 minutes to check us in.  The reason was because they were "looking for our room".  What does that mean?  We paid for the rooms, why aren't they ready?   Then they said they overbooked.  That's not my problem.  Eventually they put us in rooms that were cheaper rooms that what i paid for on Expedia.  They said they can't refund the difference and that i have to contact Expedia for that.  Very upset about the whole deal.

review.title: Back up place if there is no other choices
review.reviewText: The property is a fancier version of Motel. The room seems clean, but there is no soundproof. You can hear everything loud and clear of your next wall neighbor. The facility doesn't justify for the cost. It is just a back up place if you absolutely can't find anything in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: It is what it is.

review.title: Overpriced motel billed as hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was disappointing - at almost $200 a night, it offers little more than the most basic motel room. Spartan, poor quality furnishings, and a noisy environment outside made for an unpleasant stay. Not recommended.

review.title: Hotel in South S.F,
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel for the money deal, but the beds are bad for those with sensitive backs. Mattress was to soft or this case old and slept in.. but thats to be expected for this type of hotel. Other than that its nice to have a 24 hr restaurant in the lobby for those late night cravings. But i would recommend the hotel to anyone who just needs to lay there head down, but leave during the day for fun activities.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to S.F. and south bay area. 24hr restaurant..
review.negativeRemarks: New Mattresses.

review.title: Awesome 4 night stay in frisco
review.reviewText: Great room  nothing to complain about except the bathroom had some damage but the staff told me it would be fixed when we left very attentive.

review.title: Very close to Highway, very noisy.
review.reviewText: It is a basic hotel. It did have one of the nicest TV's that we have seen in a hotel. Room is older but comfortable. Had everything you needed. They do give you earplugs and you will need them to sleep. Traffic noise was pretty loud. They did have a shuttle to the airport that was a nice plus.
review.locationRemarks: It was within walking to a lot of shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Good price but needs updates.
review.reviewText: Close to the airport and easy highway access. Very noisy with traffic, car alarms and airport noise. Because the rooms are accessed directly from outside, no privacy. Interior was clean but needs updating. Some mold in the shower caulk, cigarette burns on comforter. If want easy and inexpensive its a good choice, but I will not go there again.

review.title: Conveniently located to SFO
review.reviewText:
It was OK, not stunning, just OK.
Having a restaurant located on the property and open 24/7 was a nice feature.

review.title: It was nice, clean, and staff was friendly
review.reviewText: Love that they were dog friendly. I would recommend to anyone

This room was very small, they only provided one bath, face and wash towel for 4 people. There was a lot of noise throughout the night. In addition, we used the toilet the first time and had to call for assistance. They brought up a toilet plunger.

review.title: It's a small room with a huge bathroom, close airp
review.reviewText: The room is ok, nothing extraordinary. Good if you have low budget and need to stay by yourself close to the airport. The staff is nice. The don't have breakfast included but there's a restaurant next door to the hotel which is open 24 hours.

review.title: Close to the SFO airport
review.reviewText: Hotel appearance and room seemed to be old and dated.  Close to the airport so you can hear the airplanes all night
review.positiveRemarks: close to SFO airport, easy parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Not charing to park if staying at the hotel.  Not sure if this is standard procedure.

review.title: It's an inn
review.reviewText:
I got in late at night and was dissapointed it was an inn type facility. I was a little scared walking through the open corridors to get to my room. Though nothing bad happened, i would not stay alone there again. I did not see any security personnel on site. The rooms are renovated, they are clean and have new flat screens. The lobby can use a little renovation as it seems really old and shabby. 
Overall good for one or 2 nights

review.title: Expensive for what you get
review.reviewText:
The restaurant in the lobby is very expensive.  It was probably double the price of what it should have been, but I guess it's because of convenience.  The restaurant is also understaffed, so service was poor. It took almost 30 minutes to flag down a waiter to get the check.
The room was decent (very plain though).  However it was expensive for no free breakfast or special services.
The laundry room was out of service until the last night of my stay.  It was $2.75 for per washer load and $2.75 per dryer load, which I believe is outrageously expensive.
The highest perk was the free shuttle service from the hotel to the airport and vice versa.
My suggestion, spend a little extra and go to a hotel that has the amenities for the price.

review.title: One of The worst hotels ever.
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival staff was good. But when I went in the room, I couldn't stand the bad smell. Sheets were wet, maybe because of moisture. 
To shorten, I went to sleep in my car, because I had an itchy feeling provoked by a filthy room.

Our hotels keys did not work all of the time.  We had to get new ones but even those didn't work.  Guests were very loud outside of our room.  Talking on the phone, and such!  Also, unexpectedly had to pay to park for each night.  Don't understand why that was necessary.
Perfect location, & a great stay! Close to several attractions, from all directions...

review.title: Printing cost 3$ / 10min if using lobby computer
review.reviewText: Extremely slow check in. Two people before us were registering parking their vehicle, and the paperwork oh my! Parking cost 10$ per night.

review.title: Nice clean hotel
review.reviewText: Nice clean room. Only wifi signal needs improvement.
It was a good place for an overnight stop in SF.
Expexctable conditions, and good price, close to San Francisco airport. There is a 24hour restaurant next to it.

review.title: Hotel is a Good Value for Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is near, and has a shuttle to / from, the San Francisco airport.  We stayed 3 nights and drove in to downtown San Francisco, which is about 13 miles north, two days to visit tourist attractions like pier 39, fisherman's wharf, the Exploratoruim, and Golden Gate Park.  Also, we found some nice running routes along the bay for exercise, although you can use the fitness facility at the Doubletree across the street.  We ate one breakfast at Leann's restaurant at the hotel and it was good.  We also ventured in to downtown Burlingame for one of our dinners at the Steelhead Brewery which we liked.  

The room itself was adequate, although somewhat dated.  It had a refrigerator, microwave, and flat screen TV, however. The bed was comfortable, although there was a hole in the blanket.  The bathroom was clean, but the bathtub had some worn spots. The towels were on the thin side.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was good for visiting San Francisco, if you have a car, and the price was quite reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel could use some "updating" - New bedding and towels. Replace bathroom fixtures and the bathtub.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is ~13 miles south of downtown San Francisco and it's tourist attractions like pier 39, fisherman's wharf, Exploratoruim, Golden Gate Park.

review.title: Convenient,clean, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Stayed 9 days,was very pleased with bang for the buck.Great bay area deal.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price ,nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Was visiting friends,was able to get everywhere from the 101.

review.title: The reviews were deceiving
review.reviewText: I will never stay at this hotel again. The staff was rude and calling other customers names & cursing in front of us during check-in. After ️traveling for 8 hours and being jet lagged, I was wakened at midnight  by a call from a rude front desk clerk asking who I was and why i called the desk when I had been asleep for at least 2 hours. He continued to press me when I was so obviously tired & didn't call. There were bugs in our room and we woke up with bites on us. It was incredibly loud and kids were running up and down the halls at all times of the night and morning.

Stayed for 1 night passing through San Francisco. There was hair (that was not mine) in the bed and in the shower. I was given a handicap room even though this was not requested. When I was checking in the client who was ahead of me came back because he was given a room that already had someone in it, and he requested a room on the 1st floor (he was on the 4th) and the lady was telling him that he didn't want a room on the 1st floor because they were the worst and not as safe; but she had just given me a room on the 1st floor!

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: The bathroom was dirty. The rooms are small. Area wasn't good and a lot of people hanging out in parking lot. I felt nervous staying there.

review.title: First time & last time
review.reviewText: I stayed four days & I had too call everyday for towels & t-paper because room was not clean, they just fixed the beds. My wife forgot a stuff animal we great sentimental value, we called several times, spoke to managers and no responds or any since of urgency.
review.negativeRemarks: They don't clean the room they just fix the beds, very disappointment
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.reviewText: Regular experience, regular wifi speed, good location and good prices
Only good thing about this place is it's fairly close to SFO and its relatively cheap. But you get what you pay for.

review.title: Ok - now they are going to charge to park!
review.reviewText: OK that's it ok nothing more to say and that said it all.
review.negativeRemarks: Stop over charging like parking.
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Affordable Clean Hotel Near SFO Airport
review.reviewText: Affordable, clean & convenient hotel near SFO Hotel with a great 24 Hour Restaurant.  The room was quiet, clean, comfortable and reasonably priced.  Ample amount of free parking and a front desk that was very accommodating, professional and friendly.  The free Wi-Fi worked great too!  Just what any person would want without the unwanted high cost.  The restaurant had an affordable and large variety of food on the menu.  I will come back again when I am catching a flight in San Francisco and not deal with the busy traffic in the morning when I commute from 2 hours away!
review.negativeRemarks: Just keep it up and not let it get run down!
review.locationRemarks: Five minutes from the airport and a lot affordable eating options near by.

review.reviewText: Water pipes are so old they creaked throughout the night.

review.title: Hotel close to SFO AIRPORT
review.reviewText:
Location difficult.... Nearby train wakes you up at 3:00 am and then delivery trucks start heading to the airport at 4:00am..non bueno...woke up exhausted.

Facility old but clean... Beds hard, toilet didn't flush well...room larger than I thought it would be.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the plumbing

review.reviewText: We arrived very late. It was hard to find parking on Fri night. It was a decent place in the price range. All we did was sleep. The attached diner was good.
review.negativeRemarks: More parking.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: this hotel is a very run-down hotel. A bit scary because it's more like a motel rather than an inn. Very expensive for what it is. The light above the sink was out, I had to have bathroom light (which is in a separate section) on to be able to have some light by the sink. There was a hole behind the toilet and the most noisy bathroom fan. Beds are uncomfortable and noisy as well. The ac/heater did not adjust to the temperature. I had to get up multiple times to turn on the heater and then turn it off because it went from one extreme to the other. I'm extremely disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: everything, a very ran down place.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the great review and recognizing the convenience of the hotel to the airport with free shuttle every 30 minutes to the airport. Onsite restaurant open 24 hours a day. Great Park and Fly packages and free Wi-Fi and HBO.

review.reviewText: Convenient to SFO rental car return. Nice having 24hr. café on site. Comfortable bed.

review.title: Little corner of the bario!
review.reviewText: Checked in after a LONG flight. 2 AM and the cops are breaking up a fight outside our room. 6 AM, and the staff is having a morning coffee party just outside our room. Great fun! Found a room at the Hilton, thank God!

review.title: Reeked of cigarettes
review.reviewText: The smoke free hotel room reeked of cigarettes. I stayed 5 nights and they couldn't switch me to a different room. The bed sheets irritated my skin. All of my clothes smelled like cigarettes when I went to work for my client. Never staying here again.

review.title: room was dirty, toilet didnt work
review.reviewText: disgusting hotel staff was worthless. printer didnt work and front desk staff didnt care

review.title: Not what it seems
review.reviewText: I was first person to show up of a long line of guests.  The clerk really took his time with no apologies to anyone behind me (about 8 people).  He wrote down two different room numbers so had to figure out which it was.  The room was small and clean but very much not what the pictures showed.  I specifically asked for a non-handicapped room on Expedia but got one anyway.  There were very little amenities here; no tea, no lotion, crappy soap, only two towels, no extra blankets, no microwave, no fridge, a really crappy desk in very cramped quarters.  I've paid less money for far better experiences.  I would not come back here.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much of anything.  The walls were VERY thin.
review.negativeRemarks: You need to accurately portray your motel online.  Don't act like its some great place because you'll get a lot more complaints.
review.locationRemarks: There was nothing to do nearby but a 24 hour diner.

review.reviewText: Small room especially for 130 price tag but ok if you like just an inn

review.title: Reasonably cheap motel with a free shuttle to SFO.
review.reviewText: The shuttle runs every half hour and stops at other hotels along the way.
Not worth writing about ... had a long layover at the airport and picked this hotel ...
review.negativeRemarks: too late ... appearance - decor - we got stuck in a handicap room that we did not order ...

review.title: Nice place to park &fly from SFO
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, comfortable room, surprisingly excellent bowl of Asian chicken noodle soup with vegetables in the best homemade broth I have ever tasted in a humble and unassuming cafe on the premises of the hotel.  My return flight was canceled and Red Roof let me keep my car there for an extra day at no charge.  I'm planning to stay there when I have to fly from SFO.
review.positiveRemarks: All of the above plus convenience.

review.title: Nice hotel in need of some rennovations.
review.reviewText: This is an okay hotel next to the airport. The staff is fantastic, but overall it needs some renovations. My doorknob fell off in my room and they fixed it promptly. The diner is open 24 hours downstairs and the parking can get tight. A good value overall but I probably wouldn't stay there unless I was in town on business, which seems to be the majority of the clientele.

review.title: Not the best
review.reviewText: The room was smaller than I expected and the bathroom was horrible. Reminded me of a college shower or jail.

review.title: Dirty room and unhelpful staff
review.reviewText:
We have stayed for 4 nights. When we checked in the room was not vacuumed nor mopped. We asked the front desk at the check in time and then the following day and the next. Somebody came and vacuumed very superficially, being more upset that he had to do such a menial job at 9 o'clock in the evening and that we moved one of the beds to the wall (because we had a small child) than that the housekeeping didn't do their job for 3 days. We realized the following day that the person was the manager. 
Also, when we checked in the sink was leaking so we put a cooler underneath to collect the water. The maintenance came and fixed the leak but they didn't even empty the container, even though it was obvious the purpose of it under the sink. 
Overall, it was a very disappointing experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, free parking, free internet, free pet stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Stayed at the hotel for recruiting purposes in the area.  If you are going to do anything around the SFO area, this is a great hotel to stay at.  I was a little skeptical with it being a RRI, but it is the nicest one that I have ever seen.  

The area itself is great and you are only minutes away from great food and shopping in Burlingame.  Would recommend!

review.title: totally acceptable
review.reviewText: bed was quite comfortable and we slept well.  No connecting rooms.

We spent most of the day in the city, which was only ten minutes away from the hotel. But coming  back to wind down afterwards was more than pleasant. Kids loved it. If and when I go back to cover the rest of that beautifully awkward city, I'm going to the same place.

review.title: Was not a pleasant experience.
review.reviewText: Cleanliness of the room was only good till the second day of my stay. After that trash that was not picked up. Sink and toilet was not even wiped down. Room next to the area where house keeping sets up cleaning carts. Very noisy!!!!!! Bottom line, my experience was lousy! I was suppose to stay a week and three days. I checked out early just not to have another bad experience.

review.title: Handy to SFO
review.reviewText: I liked the wood floor, but the cleaning agent smell was overwhelming. I was a late check in with an early flight out so just dealt with it rather than complain.  Everything was truly clean (the smell was not covering odors). Bed was comfy and the buses to SFO run ON TIME...one minute and you've missed the bus!  I'll try it again, hopefully with a clean but not chemical smell to the room.
Lots of noise. very small room. No working tv, no working vending machine. ..

Location was great and convenient. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. However, walls of rooms were so thin you could here everything. I had trouble sleeping and had an early interview the next day. Overall, the hotel was fine but I expected more comfort for the price.

review.title: Airport lodging on a budget
review.reviewText: Arrived late at SFO, had a very early a.m. flight out, shuttle arrived at terminal promptly, left on time in the very early morning, hotel staff was very pleasant and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: never saw anything near

review.reviewText: For the cost, I expected more.... or at least a cleaner room. Very old... needs upkeep.

review.title: 2 Star not a 3 Star Hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel is listed on the Expedia site as a 3 Start Hotel.  I give it a 2 Star.  The furniture is dated, the parking lot  & grounds in need of attention.  No amenities so to speak, so take your own soap. The standard room was pretty crammed but was clean and staff was cordial. The price was a 2 star price & should be listed as such.
review.negativeRemarks: An area dedicated for your pet to do their business; not just in the bushes.
review.locationRemarks: Good location in industrial park with many other hotels.

review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable. I appreciate the cleanness and also the dining area that was opened 24 hrs.

review.title: Short stay but decent
review.reviewText:
One night only. Nice touch - 24 hour restaurant, which I didn't expect.

Within a 10 minute drive, there are some decent restaurants - near the BART station.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport, nice view of planes landing
review.negativeRemarks: Internet access was very poor. If you have a hotspot, decent place if your normal business hotels are full.

review.title: Price was right...room was LOUD!!!!
review.reviewText: The room we had was ok inside. Nice and comfortable enough feel but when night rolled around there was constant noise due to the fact that your door faced outside and not an inside hallway. Cars in parking lot and complete conversations could be heard from people standing or walking by the room due to the large gap under the door, thin door and lack of much insulation. If you're looking for an inexpensive place and have a great set of headphones or ear plugs to drown out the noise this is your place. We will not be staying at this location again.

review.title: Red roof inn
review.reviewText: Room was remodeled, however very small and smelly.  Room had long black hairs on towels and on bed, we ask to change room and they were very accommodating. The new room had an adjoining door and neighbor was smoking cigarettes and chrissy all night. Smoke was coming into our room from under door. There was also dog food on the floor.

review.title: One Night Stay..
review.reviewText: Easy to find and quick access. Nothing elaborate but clean and comfortable.
It was further from the airport than I expected, but was fine for a layover before an early flight.

review.title: Convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: The Red Roof Inn isn't anything special and looks like it has seen better days, but for value and easily being able to get to the airport, it certainly works.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the airport. The little restaurant attached to it was ok too.
review.negativeRemarks: The building overall needs an overhaul.
review.locationRemarks: We drove over the Burlingame area (about 10 min) and found lots of great places to eat.

review.reviewText: Beds are just twin sized. Room was very congested. They didn't provide basic amenities like shampoo and mosturing lotion and not even enough towels. It's very difficult to get to lobby. We lost the way twice in that night stay. Overal our stay wasn't satisfactory.

review.title: Utilitarian Hotel Near SFO
review.reviewText:
The courtesy van comes once every 30 minutes, and may depart the airport before it's scheduled arrival time. Some other nearby hotels seem to have much more frequent shuttle pickups. 
The room was plain but clean.
review.positiveRemarks: The little 24-hour coffee shop and bar actually had really good food (although service was not always its strong point; e.g., coffee refills.
review.locationRemarks: It's within walking distance of the Bay Trail. Also a nice Kincaid's restaurant.

review.title: A very noisy hotel
review.reviewText:
Not sure if it was the water pipes or elevator but this was the noisiest hotels we have ever stayed in.  Because our room was on the north side the airport noise was also bothersome. 
The room was not restocked completely every day with coffee, soap or shampoo.
The only positive was the free parking for a vehicle.

review.title: Lipstick on a pig
review.reviewText: The motel has nicely renovated rooms...but during the makeover they neglected to expel the the roaches that still occupy the place!  Housekeeping does a lousy job of cleanup...we found leftover guest remnants in the room upon check in. ..no soap, towels, etc.  This place is the classic example of lipstick on pig.

review.title: Nice , clean & quiet
review.reviewText: Had a great nights stay at the red roof inn !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: No sleep
review.reviewText: Couldn't sleep due to ill fitting door allowing noise and cold draught in though a 1cm gap at bottom.  Find somewhere else as staff didn't rectify or care
review.negativeRemarks: Modernisation and properly fitted doors
review.locationRemarks: Was close to airport

review.title: Good price
review.reviewText: Dogs free was nice. Parking was tight but free! Some maintenance required but wasn't a deal breaker. Overall good experience!

review.title:
Stay at Red Roof I










Stay at Red Roof Inn
review.reviewText: Ate dinner at 24 hour Hotel restaurant and 6am Breakfast--Sausage and Oatmeal bowl and Raspberry lemonade.Excellent. Asked where I could buy Toothbrush and Toothpaste.  Desk manager went into side room. Provided me small plastic tooth brush and 4 packs of toothpaste. Perfect. Fit my need.

review.title: Nice hotel near airport
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, small restaurant attached, walk ways between rooms a little dark.  Excellent staff, restaurant good.
review.positiveRemarks: clean, convenient to airport, free shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: better outside lighting
review.locationRemarks: Stayed one night.  Didn't explore the area.

review.title: Descent stay close to airport and SF
review.reviewText: Needed a place to stay close to work after working 16 hours and not wanting to drive an hour commute home so I stayed here. Price was RIGHT ON. 5 minutes from work so that part was cool. Room was updated to a nice decor however the tub had mold/mildew all around the caulking- bleach and water solution could easily clean and disinfect this. walls in bathroom had some sort of old dried up spill on it that could have easily been cleaned with ..cleaner! There was a huge stain on the very thin bed spread. Black hairs every where. In sink, in tub, on the back of toilet. Hopefully the maid service hair but still That hair should be up in a bun or pulled back while cleaning so THAT was gross.

review.title: comfortable hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: friendly staff, good breakfast cafe, comfortable bed and room
review.negativeRemarks: has that "cheap motel" room smell in room
review.locationRemarks: get on a plane the next day

review.reviewText: Pleasant and warm reception.  Comfortable rooms, excellent location

review.title: Work for what I needed
review.reviewText: Only came here to sleep didn't spend any time in the room. The only complaint I have is you hear everything going on outside. I would stay here again

review.title: Close to airport, free shuttle
review.reviewText: I ended up booking this hotel because there was a big conference in town and I was unable to book a hotel downtown or a different airport hotel.  However, I was pleasantly surprised - the hotel room was updated and comfortable, there was a free airport shuttle that ran on a schedule, WiFi was free, and there was a nice restaurant attached to the hotel.  As expected, rooms open to outside corridors, which I don't like.  Airplane noise was apparent too.  However, for the price, convenience, and unexpected updates and amenities, I was very happy with this choice.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice updated room, clean, free WiFi, scheduled airport shuttle, attached restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Anything to cut down airplane noise in room.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: Okay place to stay in transit.  Radio went off at 2:56am full blast which was not good; when I reported it at the desk in the am, they weren't particularly apologetic. Decent 24 hour cafe attached.

review.title: Convienent location
review.reviewText: Lobby staff was rude(two big Hispanic ladies), the gentleman was nice. Our room keys wouldn't open the door every night we came back to the inn. Had to go all the way to the lobby to get them working again

review.title: They have a good restaurant.
review.reviewText: Thought the staff was somewhat rude, but I guess you get what you paid for.

review.title: Sketchy. Worried about my personal safety. Dirty,
review.reviewText: Very disappointed with quality of motel. Dirty, bad bed, loud AC lumpy pillows no carpet on floor dirty pool loud neighbors basically a really crappy MOTEL

review.title: Not a fan
review.reviewText: The first room they gave me hadn't been cleaned.  My keycard didn't work when I got back from work requiring me to get another one from the lobby.  The hotel isn't in pristine condition to say the least.  I certainly won't be coming back

review.title: Bad experience- would not recommend
review.reviewText:
we booked a 2 night stay at the Red Roof Inn. We were given a room on the top floor, which is just ok. The room was really small and had a musty smell.  there were only 2 towels provided in the room. We specified in our booking that we were traveling with a child. Called front desk to request for an extra towel. We got told to go down to the front desk and get our extra towel because there was no housekeeping that could bring our towel.  Few minutes later, we found out that the toilet flush didn't work. Called front desk again to report the problem. They decided to move us to another room because they don't have anyone to fix it right away. 
On our second day, we requested for them to make up and clean our room. We even put the door sign to make up our room.  We were out the whole day touring the sights, and we got back to the hotel, we were shocked to find out that nobody cleaned the room. Housekeeping only put fresh towels and took the trash. We called front desk but the lady who answered was not even apologetic. They didn't care! We had to again! go down the lobby to get one extra towel because housekeeping took our 3 towels and only left 2 fresh towels. Upon checkout, we agin mentioned the problems that we encountered to the front desk and again, they were not even apologetic! The guy checking out in front of us also complained that he found a huge spider in his room. I think that is also worth mentioning, We will never book at any Red Roof Inn again! Very unpleasant stay
review.negativeRemarks: Should improve on yourpoor customer service and cleanliness. Train your hotel staff To handle customers' issues.  We know what is good and bad service
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.reviewText: the woman staff at front desk was very rude. I was like it was a problem to help. as far as the room it was clean

review.title: Business trip
review.reviewText: Compared to the other hotel / motel rates in the immediate area, I thought it was a good value. The rooms are clean, and there is a cafe/dinner on the property. I would, and probably will stay here again

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: In terms of cleanliness, it was pretty good. However, the hotel staff messed up the check-in by giving me a room that's already occupied. They apologized and explained that it was due to their system being slow in processing the rooms. Outside wind/air blew into the room through the edges of the door, but it wasn't too bad. Room wasn't stocked with soap or shampoo so I had to call them about it (my friend's room was stocked properly though).

review.title: Red roof inn by the airport
review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel. Our room was updated. Plenty of parking spaces. We traveled with 2 kids and the room was pretty comfortable for the 4 of us. I would have given it a 5 star but because our room didn't come with a fridge or microwave as advertised, it's only getting 4 stars. Staff at the front desk was very helpful. A short drive from a lot of eateries. Overall, a good location and we would stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel for a quick stay.
review.reviewText: Door didn't close tightly. Other than that, good experience.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Reasonable rates and clean rooms.  Beds were comfortable.  Restaurant on site was delicious.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Location is good close to airport, liked room and shuttle services to the airport. Rates are very reasonable compared with other. Choose d this hotel because of free parking.
It was a good experience. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Terrible hotel at the airport.
review.reviewText: This was a terrible hotel and would never stay there again or recommend it to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Located near the airport.

review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff. Nearby restaurants and close location to SFO.

review.title: No Wi-Fi signal in my room
review.reviewText: Wi-Fi tech was rude on the phone and indicated wifi signal doesn't reach corner rooms. Yet wifi set-up guide is in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi signal

review.reviewText: Good stay but the fridge didn't work... Comfy beds

review.title: Good place for the price
review.reviewText: Because it was near the airport, we just needed a quick overnight stay for a flight layover. It was far from a luxury hotel stay, but it served it's purpose - clean room, clean bed, a diner attached for a quick morning breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle to/from the airport, and the diner attached to the lobby made it convenient

review.title: Convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: We were there for 3 nights, and except for making the beds the maid did very little cleaning. Before my trip I had questions about a few things to do with the location and amenities, and at least half of the times that I phoned the hotel nobody picked up the phone. Food from a previous guest was in our mini-fridge when we arrived. The coffee set-ups were not refreshed daily.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were pretty comfortable and there was a free shuttle to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service!
review.locationRemarks: There is no bar in this hotel, but there were bars and restaurants in the nearby hotels.

review.title: always excellent w/ Red Roof in Burlingame.
review.reviewText:
WIFI didn't reach the back rooms; otherwise, Red Roof at Burlingame/ airport is always in my top three
(3) hotels as a pick to stay at.
review.positiveRemarks:
clean property & rooms, non-smoking policy, airport pick-up, friendly staff, 24 hr restr, ocean walk_1/2 block,
 air is clean, quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: I see the free hot coffee & tea; but, plz bring back the free hot chocolate.
review.locationRemarks:
1) 5 min from airport
2) Bart train to SFO at the airport_ fare is $8.65 vs a cab $$$
3) good food at the hotel restr_ US, Thai, Mex

review.title: Competent with caveats
review.reviewText: As a place to crash, this Red Roof is great. But if you need WiFi, this isn't the place. The signal is flaky and almost unuseable.

review.title: Better than I thought
review.reviewText:
Staff very friendly. Room was clean, no bad smell. Beds and pillows pretty comfy. Room was fairly quite considering it was near the airport. The only annoying thing is that the sink is not in the bathroom, so if you want to wash your hands in the middle of the night then you will wake up anyone else in the room. 
The shower was fine, good water pressure and heat. 

The diner attached to the hotel was surprisingly good and open 24 hours a day.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the city, airport and 101 hwy
review.reviewText: It was a gd hotel, situated just a min from the 101 hwy. I can't complain of anythino due to the fact that price for this room was amazing compared to other hotels. The room was clean. 24hr restaurant. May be the service is not gr8 but ok.

review.title: SFO airport
review.reviewText:
It took me an hour to get to the hotel from a shuttle pick up place!!!. Check-in was fast, hotel staff was friendly. Room is well equipped for business travelers. Wifi was not very fast and not very stable, but definitely OK for budget hotel. In a bathroom I was found a few long hairs in a floor, which are stayed after next day visit of housekeeping. Otherwise - no complains. Towels were clean, staff -friendly, neighborhood is safe. Decent and quiet place to stay.
Hotel offers AAA discount; not sure that Expedia does.

review.title: Convienent & Comfortable
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised, hotel is close to airport and other amenities but also quiet.

review.title: Great Lay-Over Hotel
review.reviewText: While this property is 'smoke-free' - they were considerate enough to provide outdoor ashtrays for those of us who still enjoy a smoke.  More importantly, they have kindly allowed pets and plenty of room to walk them.  I have always been a "RedRoofie" for good reason:  great staffs, incredibly comfortable rooms, and again... welcome pets!  The shuttle to the airport was convenient, comfortable, and riding in the company of 5 airline pilots wasn't bad either.

Pretty good spot for people traveling with pets. There is a trail called Bay Trail right out the back door of the hotel, so it's very convenient to get your dog out and walked even while traveling. You get to the water right away, which makes for a nicer excursion.

review.title: Convenient! The prices should be lower though.
review.reviewText:
Close to the airport, clean and great staff. Also free Wifi and free parking.
The restaurant outside has some great food.
good place to stay,near the airport room was clean.bed was comfortable....
An okay experience.. Only problem no one @the front desk to check out @5:45am

review.title: Good basic hotel
review.reviewText: Everything you need works fine - the rooms are basic but clean, free WiFi and coffee in the lobby.  The lobby computer costs to use - but the front desk staff let me use their computer to print my boarding pass.  They were also pleasant - gave us an extra towel when we needed it.  It's a place just a shor ( free)t shuttle away from the airport.  No breakfast, but connected to a Denny's-style restaurant.

review.title: Not a business hotel
review.reviewText:
Clock in the room did not work properly. WiFi - while free - was not easy to connect to and had low bandwidth. Phone reception in the room was terrible. Calls continually dropped out. 

I have stayed at many other hotels in this area. I tried this one for the rate. I will not use it again. Maybe a good budget liesure hotel. Definitely not a good hotel for a business traveler.
review.negativeRemarks: Working clock. Better WiFi. Can't control the phone reception but the lack of is not a selling point.

review.title: Location, location, location.  Close to bay, mall.
review.reviewText: Great proximity to airport, bay, mall, Hwy 92 (which leads to Half Moon Bay), only 15 minutes to San Francisco!  Really clean and love the hardwood (laminate) floors.  Staff was great with no issues checking in/out.  Would definitely recommend for any one on a budget but still desires a very nice play to stay.  On a side note-Advantage car rental was less than five minutes from hotel, almost walking distance and provided a smoke free, great priced rental.
review.positiveRemarks: Hardwood (laminate) floors.  Really adds to the already clean feeling.

review.title: Internet
review.reviewText:
The wi-fi is terrible!!!!
But the fries on the restaurant beside is great!
I think is a good hotel!
Not eay to find, smelling and not the best price performance

review.title: Wonderful Hotel!
review.reviewText: I had a late check in as my flight landed at 12:10am, the shuttle driver came to pick me up at the airport and take me to the hotel and was very pleasant. I arrived in the lobby and the night manager was waiting behind the counter for me. Check in was quickly taken care of and the directions to my room were clear and concise. Plus - they have 24 hour restaurant service! The room itself was very clean and neat, they have hardwood floors! I was so pleased to not have to worry about what might be lurking in the carpeting like I do at most hotels as I tend to walk around barefoot most of the time. I slept like the dead, the bed was so comfortable! Checkout was simple (Thanks Expedia!) and the shuttle driver back to the airport took me right to my terminal. I will definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Hardwood floors, so no icky grimy carpets, fabulous staff, 24 hour restaurant and shuttle service, so very convenient for a frequent flyer to SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Mini Fridge made weird noises, I unplugged it and reported it. Staff called maintenance to fix it before I even left the lobby. Fantastic!
review.locationRemarks: Really convenient to the SFO airport!

review.title: conveniently located near SFO and 101 Freeway
review.reviewText: stayed 3 nights during a convention in downtown San Francisco; very convenient to SFO with free shuttle to and from SFO / BART; great 24 hour coffee shop downstairs;
review.positiveRemarks: location, room rate, cleanliness, quiet rooms, plenty free parking, 24 hour coffee shop
review.negativeRemarks: water pressure in shower was weak

review.title: CONVENIENCE
review.reviewText: Close to freeway, restaurant, SFO, mall. Clean hotel with hardwood floor.

review.title: CONVENIENCE
review.reviewText: Convenient to freeway access, next door cafe/restaurant, SF International Airport, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the hard wood flooring! Makes the room looked clean!
review.locationRemarks: See above comments!

review.title: This hotel provides adequate service.
review.reviewText: Passing thru SFO International required me to stay for the night. Compared to most of the hotels in the area, this hotel was realistically priced. Simple basic service without frills and a good nights sleep are what you'll get. The room was clean and maintained. The hotel staff were friendly and attentive. Would recommend this hotel as a simple business hotel to anyone.

review.title: Nice hotel, near restaurants and closed to the wat
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel no complaints here everything is closed by and the restaurant on the hotel serve good food.
Having a restaurant on the premises was great.
review.positiveRemarks: The airport / hotel pick up was convenient with extremely nice drivers.
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: n/a

review.title: Nice hotel close to the beach.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to the beach. It is conveniently located. The staff was OK, not very helpful.

review.title: Very noisy room
review.reviewText:
Room number109 was located next to the pool and behind a row of high shrubs.  As a non smoking room, there was definitely a smell of cigarette smoke.  One flannel was ripped and thread bare.
There appeared to be only one complimentary shuttle bus running on the day we were staying at the hotel.  We Waited nearly an hour to be picked up from the airport and called the hotel 3 times by phone to check that a bus was going to arrive.  Other hotel shuttles seemed to be arriving on a more frequent basis.
There was constant noise throughout the night coming from the hotel laundry, cold drink machines and ice machine which were all located outside the room.  We were finally woken at 6 am when someone from the restaurant was emptying the Ice machine.
review.negativeRemarks: Room needs redecorating
review.locationRemarks: Did not explore local area

review.title: If you're looking for a cheap place to stay...
review.reviewText:
I attended Dreamforce and needed a place to stay that wasn't going to cost my company $500/night. Red Roof fit the bill perfectly.

To start things off, we were met promptly by the shuttle outside of SFO.  The shuttle was very clean and comfortable and got us to the hotel quickly.  My colleague and I were both booked in rooms with 2 full-size beds (that's all that was available at the time of booking) but we were both pleasantly surprised that the front desk staff were excited to give us each a room with king beds instead.  Upon reaching my room, I found it to be clean and acceptable.  Nothing too fancy, but I wasn't going to be doing much more than sleeping in it, so it met my needs. Checkout was fast and easy and again the front desk staff were more than eager to meet our needs.

First would have to be the fact that the door to room 535 is hung so poorly that I could actually see out of the gap between it and the frame out into the parking lot!  I had to prop the ironing board against the door so that it covered the gap.  Second would be the very poor soundproofing between the room and the outside.  Granted, the gap in the door probably attributed to some of this problem, but until I cranked up the AC to create some white noise, people yelling outside and the loud buses made for a noisy evening.  Don't forget the occasional planes that would fly overhead and shake the whole hotel!

review.title: Nice and convenient to the airport.
review.reviewText: Easy check in. Limo to the airport was a real plus. 24 hour restaurant attached to the hotel was clean and had decent food.

review.title: Bad
review.reviewText: Bad hotel bad service dirty room they did not clean the room

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: it was great, clean and roomy.. was only there for the night but wish I could of stayed longer.. definably will return
review.positiveRemarks: very roomy , great tv, comfy beds..in room micro and fridge..
review.negativeRemarks: carpet instead of hard wood floor maybe?.. shower heads or water pressure?..

review.reviewText: While we only stayed there one night, the hotel was very clean and equipped with a pool and 24 hr bar and restaurant. I would have liked if there was a complimentary continental breakfast, but overall it was a great hotel!

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport & the city.
review.reviewText: This hotel was a nice place to stay near the airport and within driving distance to the city.  Bay trails for walking/running in the back and close vicinity to Burlingame for nearby eateries and shopping.  It was very convenient to have Leann's cafe open 24 hours right next to the lobby so it didn't require any driving if you didn't have a car.
review.positiveRemarks: The best part of the room is having a microwave & refrigerator.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning the bathroom tub for people staying longer (1-2 weeks) in the room as soap scum developed over time.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport, driving distance to the city, bay trail in the back for running/walking.  Burlingame close for eateries & shopping.

review.reviewText:
Based on the fact I used this hotel on the Oracle OPenworld Season, on a very late booking, all hotel prices were soaring high so I was fully aware the rate I paid was not the regular one, therefore I cant say if "you get your money's worth"....But tI'll do a Pro´s and Con´s 

PROS:  The hotel room  was Very Clean and Quiet enough to rest well,  comfortable as well, I'd guess its safe since I didn´t have any  incidents, the closeness to the Airport was convenient for me, the BART station is not so far so it's easy to go to the city, and the food was quite good for the price, and accesible 7x24 which is very convenient !!
CONS: The stairway access were a bit dirty and the Bathroom didnt have a thrash container

review.title: Nice location, great friendly staff.
review.reviewText:
Leticia was a great help to me several times. She was pleasant and always smiling. 
Thanks!!

review.title: Decent hotel by the airport
review.reviewText: The staff was great and the room was clean and comfortable. The complimentary shuttle came in handy since my flight was delayed and I landed after midnight. Overall, it was a great bargain!
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that is was clean and comfortable, yet affordable. The 24-hr restaurant connected to the lobby came in handy as well.

review.title: hmm
review.reviewText: Unfortunately, the lack of availability  led to the Red Roof Inn. The room was very musty smelling. The staff was ok, but no too accommodating. They said the room had been renovated, but I would not want to think what it was before. Price I felt was very high, for what you got.
review.negativeRemarks: remove the smell of the room
review.locationRemarks: plenty of things to do, all kinds of activities and restaraunts

review.title: Nice & decently priced hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay at Red Roof Inn (Burlingame/airport location).  Check in was easy since my reservations were already in place.  Got my room keys & parking permit then headed up to my room to begin my vacation.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the fact that the room had a microwave & a small refrigerator.  The room was modern, perfect for 2 people, and fairly clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Access to laundry accessories would be nice.  They ran out of supplies when I asked for some.  Daily vaccuming/sweeping (hair on floor sometimes seen)
review.locationRemarks: Located very close to the airport so it's very convenient.  Lots of restaurants nearby, great trail for running/walking near the water.

review.title: Wonderful surprise to find such a great Red Roof!
review.reviewText: Close to the SFO airport.  Therefore close to Peninsula and good transportation to the City.  Recently renovated and all up to date.  I was surprise by the great quality of the hotel for such a modest price--great value.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO!--its greatest asset.  Then you need transportation to Peninsula actives--Stanford is 30 min. south.  San Francisico is about 20 min. nor

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Reasonable rates. Close to our work site. Had shampoo, ironing board and iron. Pleasant staff. The wireless internet went on and off, however.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless internet went on and off.

review.title: Good, low cost option for a stay over at SFO
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised at the value for the cost at this hotel.  Had to stay over in SFO area to catch international flight the next day.  Most hotels in SFO area were well over $200, even $300 per night.    I stayed here for much less and got a clean, comfortable room.  Airport shuttle service worked fine.  Staff friendly.  Would stay again if need be.
review.locationRemarks: The 24-hour cafe had good food, especially for the price.  The Chinese offerings were very good.

review.title: Like a downtown bus station without the charm.
review.reviewText: Rooms were poorly designed, cramped and unpleasant to be in.
review.positiveRemarks: Really, I didn't "like" anything. The staff were okay.
review.negativeRemarks: Honestly, there isn't much short of redesigning the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport.

review.reviewText: Deadbolt kept getting stuck open but otherwise fine

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable. Have their own 24hr restaurant. Close to airport, but there was nothing else there. No fast food restaurants nearby or any shops. Room, I thought was over priced. Good for those who have an early flight, nothing else really.

review.title: Okay for one night
review.reviewText: I had an okay experience staying one night. The staff was very friendly. I needed a hotel close to the airport for one night that was cost efficient. This hotel met that criteria. My room was clean, and I got a good night sleep. Good enough for me.
review.positiveRemarks: It is close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: The outside could use some updating.
review.locationRemarks: I walked to a hotel across the street to eat dinner.

review.title: Not at this price!
review.reviewText:
To be fair, if this was priced at the normal Red Roof Inn range, I would have scored it better. However, since it was priced based on availability, I expected better.

Paint was peeling at two different locations on the ceiling. When I turned on the A/C, corn chips from a past resident flew from the vent. The wash cloths seemed to be past their service life.

 The front desk was more interested in their I-phone and texting than in checking me in.
review.positiveRemarks: Apart from the corn chips, the room was clean.  The dinner attached to the Inn was fairly priced and served a decent biscuits and gravy.

review.title: Good hotel near SFO international airport
review.reviewText: Very good and convenient hotel near SFO international airport. Rooms are good, price is reasonable.

review.title: Close to airport.
review.reviewText: Hotel was ok.  Nothing special but it is close to SFO.

review.title: AC really bad
review.reviewText: all the time, the air conditioning does not work,,,and never was fix it....so bad

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: Pretty sure that pretty much everyone here only stays for one night on arrival or leaving, and it's perfectly located to the airport for that.  The hotel itself is comfortable enough to stay in for multiple nights - rooms are well set-up, pool area is ok - needs a jacuzzi added.  Adjoining restaurant is good.  We caught the shuttle to the airport in the early hours, this is very convenient - twice an hour almost 24 hours (on demand in the wee small hours I think).

review.title: Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Over night stay to rest up before early morning flight back to Florida.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is tight.
review.locationRemarks: Very good Mexican food within waking distance.

review.reviewText: Staff very friendly even though they were badly under staffed, this made check in slow and made them inaccessible by phone. But it was obvious had they more staff, these issues would have been resolved.  Room clean and comfortable. Area in which hotel was located felt safe. Fair deal for the $$.

review.title: Nice, Quiet & Clean
review.reviewText: Great location for airport access. A little further away from San Francisco and all the "fun" than we wanted to be. But for the price and condition of the hotel it was great!!

review.title: Water problem
review.reviewText: Our room was on what I believe to be the front side of the hotel. There is a carpet mounted in front of the door that was soaked ( I  believe from rain water) leaving the room smelling very musty.  I believe a wind driven rain blew water under the overhang and under the space at the bottom of the door, soaking the carpet.This room was on the third floor.
review.positiveRemarks: Other than the musty smell, The room was more than adequate.
review.negativeRemarks: Tightening up the gap at the bottom of the door to prevent water penetration.
review.locationRemarks: The location was about a 1/2 hour drive from San Francisco making it convenient.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Shuttle was good. Leanns restaurant was excellent.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText:
The hotel overall was adequate for what it is; a cheap room in the Bay Area. The room was clean, but also small, with no furnishings besides the two double beds, a chair, and a small desk/table area with a small TV, and mini-fridge. My only real complaint was the mattresses. It felt like laying on a stiff couch.

If you are in town for business, pay extra for a better room at a better hotel. It would have been worth the extra money for me to get a good nights sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was affordable, and the location was good.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattresses for sure. I would even have paid more for an "upgrade" in quality, if it were available.

review.title: San Francisco Adventure
review.reviewText:
The Good:
Hotel location is great if you want to go to San Francisco, Napa or anywhere south. There is no traffic around the hotel. It is very close to the airport and to the water (walking distance) You can walk to the waters edge and watch the planes land and take off at San Francisco international airport. Very cool thing to do. The front desk staff was very pleasant. 

The Bad:
If you are staying here you will obviously have a rental car or your own. Parking is free but finding it can be a challenge. It seems there are more rooms than spots. What complicated the matters worse are tour buses. They have no where to park so they either take up multiple spots or block you in. I was late for my convention because a bus driver could not make a turn in the parking lot, left his bus unattended for 20-30 minutes and had to get a guest up at 7:30 am to move her car so he can pass. Very infuriating. I wasn't the only one blocked in. 

The room. Seemed clean. Bathtub and sink we're not well cleaned, I found crumbs and chips under one of the beds. One night I killed a cockroach. It seems like the cleaning staff only changed the sheets and towels, the rest was our problem. I would not stay here again for that reason.

On the day of the check out (noon) my girlfriend was annoyed because at 11:30 the cleaning staff was doing rounds for check out. She told them she would be out in a few but they didn't seem to understand. She wasn't pleased.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness! and parking
review.locationRemarks: Do yourself a favor, go get IN-N-Out burger nearby, park at the waters edge and watch the plans take off and land.

review.title: To much Money

Motel 6  run down food bad and room dirty  .  I would not stay here again I know if you near the air there is not much
to choose form but this is a pit.

If you're looking for something fancy, this motel won't do it for you. But, if you're simply interested in a clean room near the airport for a reasonable price, this place is perfect.

review.title: Will not return...
review.reviewText:
Unfortunately, our stay at this hotel was very disappointing. The first room that was given to us was occupied with other people, so we had to bring all of our luggage and children back down to the first floor, from the fifth floor, to go back to the main lobby. Once I got back to the lobby to tell them that the room given to us was occupied, the lady at the counter didn't even apologize or say, "i'm sorry about that, let me check." She just said, "Let me see," and took the keys with the room number on it. It was after she checked on the computer that there was an error was when she said, "Sorry about that."
Once we got to our new room, we found dirty, wet washcloths on the bathroom toilet. There was also no remote. We called down to the lobby and someone retrieved the dirty washcloths and brought us a remote. The next morning, my husband was going to make coffee, but found an old filter with coffee grounds still in the coffeemaker, which did not belong to us. We were very glad that we only booked for one night and were more than happy to get out of this place!
review.negativeRemarks: This Red Roof Inn needs to work on their customer service and cleanliness of rooms.

review.title: Affordable hotel do not stay on the first floor.
review.reviewText:
We had a pet. While all the rooms are identical and have hardwood floors we were placed on the first floor. Everything was okay until the second night. Around 1:30 in the morning someone checked into the room next door. Immediately, the man and women were talking loudly and the child was screaming at the top of her lungs. Then the man started to try to open the door joining the two rooms. He was attempting to get into our room. We then went to the front desk and complained they called the room to tell him to be quite. He didn't stop. The child was still screaming and the man was still talking very loudly at now 2:00 am. We complained again and evidently three other's had called. The receptionist had called three times but the man next door to our room still continued.
The manager gave us another room on the second floor. This room not only didn't have a door joining two rooms but also had a microwave and fridge despite being the same size and identical in every other way. Had we had a room on the second floor our stay would have been a perfect 5. If you stay here stay on the second floor or above.

The receptionist who was on the night was very helpful. He understood the problem and gave us another room without any hassle. He really helped move our stay from a nightmare to a pleasant experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, nice location, and great price.
review.negativeRemarks: Do not stay on the first floor. Policy changes to deal with loud and inconsiderate guests more effectively.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame is a great little city outside SF. Also a short drive to the Millbrae BART station were you can park for a buck and take BART into SF

review.title: Good Value near San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Very pleased with this hotel. It provided comfortable, clean room at a good rate especially for its location. We were delayed a night due to a missed connection. Hotel not only held our reservation it refunded a nights stay. We also enjoyed the restaurant located on site.

Only once in a while could you actually hear one, but never did it keep me awake or wake me up in the middle of the night. I think the traffic on the road was worse than the plane noise. Laundry on site. Restaurant on site. I would stay there again. Stayed there 8 days this time and enjoyed it except for the beds were a little harder than I like, but the pillows were the only horrible thing. Bring you own pillow and itll be great.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and very friendly staff. Restaurant on site.

review.title: Good for overnight business

While it's bascially next to SFO they have rooms that are fairly quiet but it's a good idea to let the desk know that's important. There is also a little bar and restaurant (privately owned) that has a nice mix of Asian soups and conventional Western fare with room service until 9 p.m. The room was clean and comfortable enough but would have been a bit better if it had a microwave and small fridge. The desk was also very helpful printing out my boarding pass. For an airport hotel and the price this was a good deal.

Red Roof is no luxury hotel, but it was 1/3 of the price of the Westin and my room was just fine. Bonus points: I left my tablet charger there, and the housekeeping staff had turned it in to the front desk where they held it for me so I could pick it up on my way home. Nice!
