review.title: Excellent for a cheap hotel
review.reviewText: There were no hotel rooms available under $700 a night when I booked my trip due to Dreamforce convention going on --- this was the ONLY hotel I could find within a reasonable distance for a price I was willing to pay. I usually stay at Westin so I was not too happy about staying at a Red Roof and not really looking forward to my stay. However, the staff at this location was super helpful and friendly. There is a 24 hour food place attached where the food is edible (the udon soup not bad, diner food okay) and the staff really nice. A few good beers (Stella) in their fridge as well. For 1/3 of the price of my usual place, I was very happy overall. It was reasonably clean and safe and conveniently located for the meetings I had. Nothing to worry about here. And you can use the money you save on a nice dinner at Stella Osteria in Burlingame (highly recommend that place.)
review.positiveRemarks: Safe, 24 hour food good for late arrival, reasonably clean and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Be sure to bring something to block out light while you sleep. And noise.
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO, decent commute to Redwood City and surrounding area. Downtown Burlingame is cute with some good place to eat.

review.title: Refurbished and Nice : )
review.reviewText: I had a Superior King Room and it was exceptional for the purpose of my trip; a job interview nearby. There was a desk in the room and free Wi-Fi for me to get work done, both a microwave and refrigerator so I could bring my own food and not have to eat out, a 37 inch flat screen TV to watch, an ironing board and iron to help me look my best, a hair dryer and coffee maker, and a tub/shower combo to help me relax after a long day. The King bed was very comfortable and there is an air conditioner/heater in the room that you can adjust to fit your needs.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is very accomodating and the room was in impeccable condition. I felt very safe and comfortable here.
review.negativeRemarks: The tub had a rough floor, which I assume is to keep you from slipping when you shower, but makes having a bath uncomfortable.
review.locationRemarks: You are close to San Francisco Airport and 18 miles from the city, BUT travelling time DEFINITELY varies DEPENDING ON TRAFFIC, which can be horrible!

review.title: it's just another hotel, nothing special or bad.
review.reviewText: I'd stay here again when I need to save money.short distance to bay, but no restaurants near by, just the hotel restaurant, which is just ok.
review.negativeRemarks: wifi connections were slow with bad connection strength.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Room was clean & comfortable & airport shuttle ran on time

review.title: Near SF Airport with parking lot to leave your car
review.reviewText: Very nice helpful staff. very informative and helpful. Hotel is just OK, but fine if you are just staying the night and leaving your car. It costs $10 a night to leave your car in an outdoor parking lot, but there is a shuttle to and from the airport too. Other hotels that are much nicer and just as close to the airport, also allow you to leave your car, but they also cost a lot more. Other car parks cost up to $18.00 a day (indoor/stacked parking lot type). The hotel was clean, but try to get a room NOT facing the busy, noisy freeway.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, fairly good location, clean but simple rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: The rugs were a bit crummy and the rooms are a bit old, but they have tried to make it nice with newer bedspreads etc.
review.locationRemarks: It is south of the airport in Burlingame (about 20 min. south of SF ), so there's a zillion hotels nearer to the city, but it is close to the airport.

review.title: Wi-fi is bad.
review.reviewText: Everythigs are ok, but the wi-fi was really bad.
review.positiveRemarks: short distance with SFO and shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi

review.title: It was nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and I liked that it had a 24hr restaurant by the lobby. I recommend this place.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Perfect standard couple nights hotel. Wouldn't really vacation in it

review.title: The 24 hour restaurant at the hotel was the best!
review.reviewText:
Saw great reviews of this hotel.......but there is nothing great about it!
Too expensive for what you get!!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Quiet place to rest. Very helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Convenient location for business and transient stay purposes. The 24 hr leann's cafe serves superb food.

review.title: Budget Hotel with new room decor.
review.reviewText: Updated hotel was nice and very clean. Walls are thin and I could hear people walking above me (I was on the 3rd flr) so I did not get a great night sleep. There is no carpet so I think that makes the difference. New bedspreads, drapes, etc. Visually appealing for a standard budget hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel,close to SF Airport,shuttle service
review.reviewText: The room very pleasing, the staff respectful and helpful, and the convenience of a next door restaurant plus the shuttle service to the airport every half hour 24/7 makes this hotel a WINNER !!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioner noisy and difficult to adjust.
review.locationRemarks: I can not comment about this hotel in terms of "things to do near by", since all the times I have chosen the hotel is to stay over night for airtravel

review.title: Overnight Stay
review.reviewText: Excellent. Great location, clean rooms, friendly people.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Bad expereince
review.reviewText: Booked through Expedia and the room was NOT what I had booked. Booked delux king and got a dirty double. At 2 am couldn't get anyone to listen. I give a low rating to Expedia for the experience.

review.title: Red Roof SF
review.reviewText: Arrived on a late flight, had to wait 45 minutes for the van to show overall its just ok but for a one night stay and an early wakeup the next day it was just fine.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and highway routes

review.title: Good, but stay away from the elevators!
review.reviewText: The front desk staff at this hotel were among the friendliest and most helpful I have ever encountered. The hotel is close to the airport, and by using the hotel shuttle, one can easily access BART. The only real problem was that my room was close to one of the elevators. It was in serious need of repair as it was very noisy any time it was used. Its clunking and chugging could be heard at all hours; seemingly louder at night!
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, easy access to BART

review.title: A place to lay your head
review.reviewText: A good place to sleep and get up and shower and go about your way.

review.title: Worst I ever been
review.reviewText: The hotel was the worst hotel I been in my life. The TV wasn't working and the customer service was horrible. We call to let them know that the TV wasn't working and they keep on telling us that they will send the repair man to the room, after several phone calls regarding the issue. We had to go in person to tell that the TV wasn't working and they told us that there was no handy man on duty, WHY THEY KEEP ON TELLING US THAT THEY WILL SENT SOMEONE, liers. They couldn't accomodate us to another room because there was no room available. They didn't refund our money. When you call to report an issue, the front desk person was rude and mean. I will never go to the hotel again or refer a friend to this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Hired people with customer service skills
review.locationRemarks: The location is central and is closed to a lot of amenities

review.title: Highly overpriced and over-rated hotel
review.reviewText:
It's 1 star motel by room quality and service. Just a building with huge number of small rooms where people awaiting for their flights spending a single night. Parking lot is completely full, no breakfast, desinfection smell in a room.
$140+ per night? you must be kidding. Never again.
review.positiveRemarks: Cool view to SFO airport runway from closest street. But it's just hotel location. The hotel itself has no pros
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything starting from expanding parking lot.
review.locationRemarks: Quite a lot good restaurants in Burlingame nearby.

review.title: Basic room, but good value
review.reviewText: I stayed at RRI for two nights in early October. Everything was clean, checkin/out was easy, and the price was excellent compared to other chains in the area. The layout of the room was very spacious for me to work on my computer and have my suitcase open for easy access. Note that this room had laminate flooring rather than carpet; I'm sure its easier for them to maintain but I don't like walking on hard floors when I'm barefoot. There was a parking issue due to the limited # of rooms vs. spaces. It probably isn't normally too bad but there was a football game and there were a lot of people staying there because of the close proximity to Candlestick park. The woman at the desk was very helpful and told me about a place across the street where I could park (spaces are for the bayfront walk which is across the street from hotel). Wasn't very thrilled about the breakfast I had at the restaurant at the lobby of the hotel, however the free coffee offered by RRI was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious rooms, good location to SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs more parking.
review.locationRemarks: Jogging path across the street. Not impressed with Leann's restaurant (overpriced, poor service, bland food).

review.title: Fair hotel
review.reviewText:
Phone reception is a problem
Not very comforyable bathroom requires additional appliances

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was ok. AC was so loud it sounded lke and airplane landing. off and on all night
review.negativeRemarks: AC
review.locationRemarks: 2m from airport

review.title: Motel
review.reviewText: Needs updating and a remodel. Bath has stains from wear and tear. Bedroom has no wardrobe, just a small rail. Cobwebs on ceiling. No window to open, the only window at the front is sealed, yes there is air conditioning, but too noisy to sleep with it on. We felt it was claustrophobic and dark. Will not revisit this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Everything! Although I have to say the staff were excellent.
review.locationRemarks: It's a good twenty minutes from San Francisco and therefore not ideal.

review.title: Mold in the shower
review.reviewText:
Mold in the shower was gross.
Leann's Restaurant next door was excellent.

review.title: 3 day stay
review.reviewText: hotel was ok, not bad and not excellent, convenient for the airport and to transfer to san fran.
review.positiveRemarks: services where good, bedrooms good size.
review.locationRemarks: hotel bus transfers to airport then bart system into san fran within the hr

review.title: Nice clean airport hotel - no complaints at all
review.reviewText: Red Roof Inns are a fairly solid choice of hotel, I have stayed at several of their airport hotels before when stuck in transit and they have always been good. We had a very early morning flight from San Francisco airport, a very busy time of year so other airport hotel prices were expensive - mostly above $200 per night. Since we were only spending about 6 hours sleeping in our hotel room and not using any of the facilities this was a little steep! Red Roof Inn had a much better rate (we booked through Expedia), with good facilities, & our room was large, clean and comfortable, with a very large bed, plus fridge and microwave. There was a small swimming pool and a 24 hr restaurant on site but we did not use either due to our short time there. Would definitely recommend this hotel for an airport layover.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rates compared to other airport hotels. Regular airport shuttles.

review.title: Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was a drab version of the professional photos. It was as though they had been taken 5 years ago and everything was the same but older and a bit tired.
review.positiveRemarks: The shuttle bus to the airport was great and so was the shower.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs a bit of a makeover.
review.locationRemarks: The shuttle got us to the hotel from SFO in about 10 mins. We used the shuttle next day to get to the airport and used the BART to go into San Fran.

review.title: Near the Airport
review.reviewText: I had trouble with the entry card-reader. Originally. the staff thought the device needed new batteries, but replaced the entire device. It took about an hour to fix.
review.positiveRemarks: I forgot a jacket in the room and the staff prepared it for shipping and pick-up.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: front desk very patience and nice, one of the ladies, she help us to book a car for one day tour of San Fransico. thank you so much.
review.negativeRemarks: no
review.locationRemarks: no

review.title: Hotel was dirty
review.reviewText: Dirty hotel, unfriendly staff. Way overpriced for what you get

review.title: Boardwalk
review.reviewText: It was a 1 night stay we drove from oc so we where so tired room was old but clean . Beds where cozy . Checked in late night and left early . Great distance to boardwalk you can walk to it . And close to stores
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are old
review.locationRemarks: Great location for the boardwalk

review.title: Not worth the price hotel
review.reviewText: hotel was nice except that there's nothing nearby and only a restaurant in the hotel. Have to take the shuttle to airport and transfer elsewhere for food and shopping. I stayed a total of 8 days. After the first four days I went for a 4 days tour to Yosemite, Las Vegas and Grand Canyon. I enquired about leaving my two big luggages in the hotel, after all I am coming back to stay again but was denied of it. I had to lugged my two big luggages with me on the tour. The hotel should at least consider letting me put my luggage there since I am returning to stay again. Anyway after that experience honestly I regretted having booked the rest of my nights with the hotel as I have found a much better one nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: room and hotel shuttle to airport
review.negativeRemarks: front desk staff.
review.locationRemarks: nothing to do

review.title: Hotel staff
review.reviewText:
After a long day of traveling we were looking for a bar/restaurant. The friendly staff provided a list of nearby bar/restaurants. They even had a wine opener for us to borrow.

There is a café that is open 24 hours. Coffee was available in the lobby 24 hours/day.
review.negativeRemarks: We had two full size beds. Would have liked to have had queen.
review.locationRemarks: Elephant Bar is only minutes away by car and has the best happy hour! It is a limited chain and is definitely worth checking out.

review.title: pretty dreadful.
review.reviewText: pretty dreadful; won't stay there again if I can help it.
review.positiveRemarks: 24 hour diner attached that was reasonably tasty.
review.negativeRemarks: um, security, for starters.
review.locationRemarks: it is an airport hotel. an airport is nearby. best thing to do there is to fly away from the red roof inn.

review.title: Modestly priced motel in great condition
review.reviewText: Red Roof Inn was touted as the #1 value hotel at the SFO airport and I would agree. Very clean and in terrific condition for a budget-priced property. The room size was adequate but by no means large. I'd call it average for a budget motel, however. The beds were super comfortable, the air conditioner was effective and quiet, and everything -- plumbing, TV, elevator, etc. was in good working order. There was a small refrigerator and microwave, too. We didn't use the pool, but it looked clean and inviting. We had dinner and breakfast at the reasonably-priced attached café and enjoyed both, although the service was on the slow side. Used the airport shuttle at about 10 in the morning, and it only took 10 minutes or so. All in all, a fine experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Value -- excellent motel for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Motel is not too far from downtown Burlingame, and just down the street from a nice walking path along the Bay.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel Close To The Airport
review.reviewText: Very comfortable beds and nice restaurant on the property open 24 hours. I was pleasantly surprised, the hotel room was much nicer than I expected it to be :)

review.title: Good basic hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Elevator was out of service for a few hours on Sunday but quickly repaired the next day.
review.locationRemarks: Be sure to sample the cuisine at Kincaid's across the street and just down the way.

review.title: Not Best Value for what you pay
review.reviewText: Several airport hotels nearby (San Francisco Airport). The elevator did not work (my room was on the Third Floor, lugging luggage!). The bathroom fan was too noisy. No food is provided in the morning. The price paid was too high for what one can pay nearby for better accomodations. Same airport shuttle handles the nearby hotels, so nothing special about this Red Roof providing "their own" airport shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the elevator and the noisy fan in the batrhroom
review.locationRemarks: Airport Hotel

review.title: Okay but no more
review.reviewText: The hotel was more of a motel as the doors faced onto an open balcony. This would have been fine except that there was not much insulation and we could hear every word that was spoken outside our door, every bird's song and every luggage wheel. Therefore, if you are looking for a good night's sleep, this is not the place to go. The location is convenient however and the price was very reasonable.

review.title: Overnight
review.reviewText: We stayed one nignt before flight. Room OK and clean. Did not like fact the opened to outside.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: I needed a hotel that fit my company's budget and had the amenities needed. This hotel had free WiFi, a small Restaurant, comfortable bed and free parking.

review.title: Needed to put our feet up
review.reviewText: We needed an extra night in San Francisco as our scheduled flight back home was cancelled. Red Roof was available at short notice, and we were not disappointed. Just needed a comfy bed and an undisturbed few hours of sleep as we had spent most of the night in Oakland airport!

review.title: Great airport hotel for under $100
review.reviewText: Very helpful and friendly reception staff. Good food at on site restaurant. Airport Shuttle timely and efficient. Rooms very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Reversing trash lorry at 4am.
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Francisco Airport with free airport shuttle. No Freeway noise, but close enough for quick journey to Airport.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: My son recommended us to stay in this hotel based on his previous experience. While over hundred dollars per night was not cheap (although they offer 40 rooms daily at $69.95/night rate to airline staff), we were impressed with cleaniness and comfort of the room. My initial concern of highway 101 and airport noise was not materialized, maybe because we were so tired at night and slept well anyway. The room setup is very simple with only very basic equipment and tool there. The hotel staff was not the best but OK.
review.negativeRemarks: Room facilities.

review.title: Best stay!
review.reviewText: Very clean and nice staff, quiet room and very comfy bed!
review.negativeRemarks: that i did not stay longer
review.locationRemarks: san Francisco was amazing to see!

review.title: Very comfortable King Room
review.reviewText: We only stayed here for one night but the bed was super comfy and the free shuttle to both the airport and downtown Burlingame was great!
review.negativeRemarks: General appearance is a bit shabby on the outside.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for an overnight stay in SF as it's right next to the airport (with free shuttle).

review.title: Nice alternative to the more expensive hotels.
review.reviewText: Nice looking room with good beds. It's on a busy street so it was a little noisy at times. They don't have a complimentary breakfast, just coffee. No real lobby to speak of but for a quick stay it has everything you need including an ironing board and iron.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms decorated nicely. Free parking for tenants.
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast would be nice. I've stayed I. less expensive hotels that had this.
review.locationRemarks: Good location to nice restaurants, the SF airport, and an easy drive to San Francisco.

review.title: Nice remodeling
review.reviewText: My room had obviously been recently remodeled. Loved the hard wood floors. Made the room feel very clean and bright. The bed, lighting and furnishings were also new and very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: I was heading to airport in the morning and it was very convenient. Took me 5 miutes to get there.

review.title: Nice hotel near to airport.
review.reviewText: It was a nice experience for me. Staff are very friendly. It is very comfortable hotel.

review.title: Wouldn't go back
review.reviewText: First time at an RRI so probably expected too much....

review.title: nice option for quick access to SFO
review.reviewText: Nice inn with close distance to SFO, room is nice, bed was not so great, a little too firm for me

review.title: 2 star value
review.reviewText:
Comfortable bed, good sized room, clean, reasonably close to the airport. The restaurant at the hotel was a pleasant surprise. Asian meets American diner food. Good quality food, huge portions, and the cheapest prices I saw anywhere during my 8 day trip.

If you need to gas up your rental car, avoid the gas station closest to the hotel. They clearly don't want anyone's business. My Canadian credit card wouldn't work at the pump so I went inside to ask about alternatives. The only one he gave me was to leave my card with him, and therefore out of my sight. I wonder if he thought I was stupid? I refused and he told me he didn't want my business. Fair enough - I didn't want to give it to him anyway. Go a few blocks further to the Sunoco. They're friendly and will tell you how to get the pump to work with a foreign credit card.
review.locationRemarks: Is in an industrial/office area so not many choices for food/entertainment. There's a great trail along the bay accessible from the parking lot.

review.title: Rooms not big enough for a family
review.reviewText: Beds were a lot smaller I was told they were queen size but actually smaller than a uk double size bed. Very basic hotel. Some reception staff could have been a lot more friendlier and more helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed size
review.locationRemarks: Location good as free shuttle bus every half an hour

review.title: OK hotel with the price, room for improvement
review.reviewText:
Room has no window that could open and the air in the room was not good
No regular room clean everyday without request
Wireless reception was really bad in room
Bed sheet was not soft enough and kinda scratchy

Room is clean
Good value
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room with good value Good location with shuttle to airport
review.negativeRemarks: WIFI signal should be stronger

review.title: Good hotel by the airport
review.reviewText:
We found everything we needed.

When arriving we asked for a crib in one of the two rooms we had booked.

It was installed inn the room before we got in there five minutes later.

One other pleasant feature is that pets are allowed.

review.title: njoye Stay
review.reviewText:
Service was great and the shuttle service to and from the airport is great when travelling alone. Leanne's restaurant very convenient and food plentiful, good that it open 24hrs too.
Loved that hotel close to the bay and the walkway for people like me that love to walk. Would definately stay here again.

review.title: Great accommodation for the price you pay
review.reviewText: My overall experience was a positive one. The room was a clean. The attached diner and free airport shuttle was a great amenity. The only drawback was the odor in the room. The inn is supposed to be smoke free but it reeked of cigarette smoke. Other than that, I enjoyed my brief stay.

review.title: Excellent choice for a hotel near the SF airport!
review.reviewText:
Excellent, in every way! No issues at Front Desk. Check in time is 1pm--that came in handy!
Room not only ready but were offered a number of different rooms on different floors--all ready for check in. Plenty of parking, even for Motor Coaches.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, well maintained, quiet, within walking distance to a place to eat, great price for room
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Great, easy to find.

review.title: Great hotel for a quick stay
review.reviewText: Great quick stay by SFO. Comfortable bed. Very reliable WIFI connection. Love the 24-hour restaurant adjacent to the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximitiy to the airport, bay view
review.locationRemarks: great location by the airport

review.title: Family friendly
review.reviewText: It was a nice enough room, small for our family. The floor was hardwood, which I liked cause carpet is so gross, but there were dust bunnies in the corners. I dont think I would stay again, but my husband said he didnt mind it. Its a decent hotel for familes and cost effective, but if the pool is the reason your staying make sure its working! It was FREEZING cold and wasnt going to be fixed while we were there, HUGE bummer for our kids. They were great about refunding the rest of our money so we could move hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: teeeeeny tiny bathroom and broken heater on pool.
review.locationRemarks: good location for commuting in and out of San Fran.

review.title: Modern & Affordable!!!
review.reviewText: Modern & up to date room! Great service and very affordable! Fantastic place to stay!!!!
review.locationRemarks: RIGHT by the airport!!

They did have a 24 hours restauarant attached to the hotel but it was not that good.. I wish they had some breakfast included in the price for their hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The trail outside the hotel for walking, jogging in the morning
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant.. was not that good

review.title: very cozy hotel to stay
review.reviewText: Its comfortable hotel to stay....very refreshing & cozy ,all staff are courteous & very kind

review.negativeRemarks: nothing

review.title: pleasent

review.negativeRemarks: smoke smell
review.locationRemarks: Burlington, Ca

review.title: Excellent Budget Hotel for the Traveller
review.reviewText: Great location. With the backwaters, and the view, an excellent value for the price you pay. Very comfortable bedding, clean environment. Pollution free structure. Ample parking space. Totally worth every penny. The staff are very friendly. The only trouble I faced was my key card didn't work every time I came back. Apparenly some issue of demagnetization. The hotelier said it might be because of placing it in a leather wallet, but who doesn't carry a leather wallet these days.
review.negativeRemarks: Key Cards which don't work or are too sensitive
review.locationRemarks: Excellent Location, Surrounded by Water on Two Sides. Quite the view. Peacefula and safe neighbourhood.

review.title: great and clean for the money

review.negativeRemarks: the heated pool was cold and the beds were very soft
review.locationRemarks: great, not far from the airport and a reasonable drive into the city

review.title: Scary for a single person.
review.reviewText: Very mediocre. More a fear of safety. Police in parking area. Bed was lopsided so unfortable. Bed had hairs in it. Staff were nice.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco airport

review.title: Great hotel for couples and families.
review.reviewText: My wife and I had an excellent experience at this hotel. The room was clean and looked as it did in the online picture. The staff was friendly and helpful I will definitely stay at The Red Roof Inn again. The location we stayed at in (Burlingame) had an attached restaurant called Leanne's which is open 24 hours and very good! We can't wait to visit the area again.

review.title: Quick stay
review.reviewText: We just needed a place to sleep and shower while we visited SF. Nothing fancy, but hotel was clean and met our needs.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We only stayed 1 night for the purpose of waking up for a 0630 flight. They shuttled us, and were very helpful and friendly through the whole trip!
review.positiveRemarks: updated decor in rooms. comfortable. great price.

review.title: One Night Stay to connect with flight.
review.reviewText:
Very good service at the desk. Clean and comfortable accommodations. Restaurant attached with good selection of food , quick service and great prices.
Too bad the pool had just opened, and the water was cold! Nobody's fault - just too early in the season.
Free shuttle service to the airport very good and much appreciated!
review.locationRemarks: Near airport was good for us.

review.title: economy sleep and move on
review.reviewText: Ok for a brief stay-a place to sleep and move on. So much to do and see in the San Francisco area that this was inexpensive and close to airport (but a little hard to find-bring a Garmen!). I was not impressed with the attached restaraunt.

review.title: Very friendly stuff and clean hotel.
review.reviewText: The room was clean and renovated. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The beds were very comfortable.

review.title: Efficiency & clean
review.reviewText:
One nite w/3 persons (2 older sons). Only chose room w/2 doubles - fine for one nite w/ski equipment. Place was very clean, neat, many table areas for electronics. Heard highway noise all nite - so request room on opposite side of highway - away from pool. Needed more shower towels, but late arrival & early departure precluded asking for extras.
Certainly very convenient, did not eat at hotel, but shuttle service & front desk amicable & efficient.
Highly recommend for price, convenience & quality - will use again as comparable to other hotels of similar status for a higher price.
review.locationRemarks: SFO airport - SOUTH

review.title: Medium level
review.reviewText: Acceptable balance price/quality. Difficult and expensive to reach San Francisco if you have not a car.

review.title: Perfect place to stay before flying out.
review.reviewText: Perfect place to stay before flying out. Small room but ok for a night or so. Very reasonable rates.

review.title: Good experience ...
review.reviewText: It was good. I liked the location because it's really close to the SFO Airport. I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Clean; Not bad for the price.
review.reviewText: This was a one-night stay near the airport so we didn't have to travel far to get to our early flight. It was nice to have Leann's little diner attached to the motel for a quick bite at night and in the morning. Not much to look at from the outside, but the room was clean and not bad for the price. Bathroom was small. Heating/AC unit was very noisy but worked. Decent location 3 mi south of the airport, and easy access to 101N to get there.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness of room, convenience of Leann's diner attached
review.negativeRemarks: tight parking spot
review.locationRemarks: 3 mi south of the airport, and easy access to 101N to get there

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: It is a great hotel, but I would not recommend it if you are trying to spend more time in downtown san francisco, it is too far away from there, but overall great hotel of you are trying to stay in the city of Burlingame!

review.title: Nice!
review.reviewText: Pretty nice hotel. I love the updated look of the rooms. It's especially nice for a Red Roof Inn. The restaurant on site is a nice touch too.
review.negativeRemarks: The check in was less than courteous. I think that's San Francisco in general
review.locationRemarks: The location is great for the airport.

review.title: Good place near SFO
review.reviewText: Very nice staff and excellent shuttle from the airport. The restaurant was also very convenient - good selection, prices and open 24 hrs.

review.title: Noisy plumbing....
review.reviewText: The plumbing was incredibly noisy - every time someone went to the toilet or ran a tap, it felt like the ceiling shook - woke me up every time...

review.title: good gotel for near airport.
review.reviewText:
The Gentleman at the front desk helped me use the computer to check into my flight -- greatly appreciated. Check-in to the hotel was smooth.

There were stray dark hairs in the bathroom, even on the walls (and i am blond), but otherwise the room was clean.

review.title: A good, basic, reasonably priced motel
review.reviewText: This motel had all of the basic things we were looking for - a clean room with a decent bed and plumbing that worked. They also keep fresh coffee in the office for patrons. I would not bother with the attached restaurant, however. The Hilton Garden Inn has a restaurant next door is a little more expensive but worth it.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport.

review.title: Great hotel for a family vacation on a low budget.
review.reviewText: No frills kind of place, but staff was so accommodating it made up for any loss of luxury. Leeann's cafe, located in the hotel was just amazing! Server at cafe (Jenny) was like family by the time we left. We have three girls who are use to better accommodations & they would all agree to stay again. Thanks Red Roof for saving us a buck!
review.negativeRemarks: Full size beds

review.title: Nice Enough
review.reviewText: The hotel as a whole, looked a little "dated." It was a very clean hotel but my entire family of 4 got absolutely NO cellphone reception in our room, grrrrr. This, on the otherhand; is a pet friendly hotel which is not as easy to find as you would think in the bay area. They also have a 24 hour restaurant there which is a plus.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a "no fee" pet friendly hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Its a dead zone for cellphones.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing really near it.

review.title: airport hotel
review.reviewText: good for one night.there is a 24 hour airport shuttle which was important.the restaurant on the premises was fair at best.the place could probably use an upgrade but it met our needs for one night and the price was right.

review.title: Nice value for its pricing
review.reviewText: we expected more per expedia's presentation, but is ok for its price

review.title: Good hotel for the price, close to the airport.
review.reviewText: This hotel was convenient to the airport. It's a no-frills location, but clean enough for the price. The attached family restaurant made for a good spot for breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi connection was poor.

review.title: Very Nice and Great Price!
review.reviewText: I was greeted promptly and checked in promptly also. Room was very clean and everything worked great. I had a pleasant and comfortable stay.

review.title: timely
review.reviewText: ok. front desk staff great. room ok, nothing great but clean
review.negativeRemarks: location
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Overall everything was what we expected. Bed wasn't as comfortable as I prefer but the room was clean and in a good location

review.title: One night - late arrival hotel.
review.reviewText: Perfect place to stay if you arrive to SF on a late night flight.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was convenient, free airport shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant in the lobby had good food but terrible service. A different operation, but just an FYI.
review.locationRemarks: Quick ride from the airport.

review.title: Comfort and convenience for all
review.reviewText:
Because of the close proximity to the airport, the secure location of the hotel, the double queen beds, and or course the reasonable nightly rate, we had an excellent experience and would recommend this Red Roof to families as well as business or single travelers.
Hotel even offers an airport shuttle service and an in-hotel restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience and close proximity to SFO
review.negativeRemarks: Rough and thin bath towels
review.locationRemarks: Just off of the 101 Freeway south of San Francisco International airport

review.title: Great for business travelers
review.reviewText: Very cut and dry... clean room, free parking, free wifi, flat screen TV, convenient to 101, not expensive.

review.title: A good place.
review.reviewText: A good place everything worked out well. I would consider going back.
review.negativeRemarks: I would like a window that opened. The only window was facing the outside corridor..
review.locationRemarks: Nice location. plenty of open space to walk in including a state park and near other hotels.

review.title: Just okay.
review.reviewText: I was expecting more, maybe my disappointment is totally my fault because of my expectation about the photos online. But it's fine...

review.title: Clean, Tidy, and No Frills
review.reviewText: The room was clean and furniture new. Bed is actually very comfortable. Bathroom nice enough. A small fridge and microwave added convenience. Simple, no frills. Pretty good for budget travel and a quick business trip. Meanwhile, there's no pad of paper nor pens. Only small packet of "Kleenex". No big problem though. One discomfort, however, was the heater in the room. When it's on, it's at full blast - like a hair dryer straight in your face.

review.title: Clean & Inexpensive Motel
review.reviewText: Nice 5 story motel with easy access to the airport and the 101. Very well maintained and clean. I was particularly impressed with the housekeeping staff. I worked in my room until the afternoon a couple of times, fully expecting that housekeeping would skip my room that day, only to come back later and find it immaculate. Neither was housekeeping pestering, as it can be at some hotels. Instead, they instinctively seemed to know when I was there and when I wasn't. The only problem I experienced was with the hotel's internet. I had to electronically file something and couldn't. I'm not sure if it was a problem with the hotel's server or the court's. Generally speaking, internet service was fine, it was just on that one occasion when I tried to electronically file those documents that I ran into trouble. However, I should also note that this hotel doesn't charge for internet service like a lot of others do.
review.negativeRemarks: One Small Internet Problem
review.locationRemarks: Close to Airport in Burlingame

review.title: Stay away
review.reviewText: The mattress was more like a hammock, the sink was clogged, reported it and nothing done. The clock radio did not work. Lots of noise. All in all, very disappointing

review.title: overnight
review.reviewText: 24 hr. resturant on site, perfect for travelers, good location, close, free shuttle to from airport.
review.negativeRemarks: little noisy
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: one night stay hotel
review.reviewText: Surely a hotel for a one night stay. Rooms in poor condition, toilet leaking and very noisy elevator close by the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet was leaking, noise
review.locationRemarks: Relatively close to the airport

review.title: Great hotel for everyone
review.reviewText: Excelent service near the airport with perfect access to the freeway

review.title: Clean!
review.reviewText: I would go back! clean very clean! I was with my baby and I never felt uncomfortable.

review.title: SFO - Close Nice Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is very close to the San Francisco International Airport (about 3 miles). The hotel offers a free shuttle running 24/7 - about every 30-45 minutes. The best part - the hotel will allow you to park for $10 per night & will pick you up at the airport upon your return. There is a restaurant on site (the breakfast was good & very reasonably priced)!
review.locationRemarks: The location is industrial (since it is so close to the airport).

review.title: Comfortable, quiet, good for SFO/Burlingame events
review.reviewText: If you have a conference at one of the expensive hotels in the SFO/Burlingame area, this Red Roof Inn provides an excellent alternative to staying at the conference hotel. You may even have the pleasure of a nice twice-daily walk along the shore of the San Francisco Bay to get from it to your meeting. The hotel is clean, very quiet, well maintained. The lobby staff is helpful, and there is a shuttle, at 24 and 54 minutes after the hour, to the airport (where you they can srop you off at the BART station to go to the city). It is also about a 30-minute walk to the beginning of Broadway Avenue in Burlingame, where there are plenty of restaurants. The only drawback, mentioned by others, is that the coffee in the lobby is awful. The coffee packs in the room actually make "less bad" coffee, which says a lot. But that's not a big deal compared to the convenience and the savings. Also, if you don't have a car and don't like to walk, you may feel that this is too far from where you want to go.

review.title: Great Shuttle catch
review.reviewText: Just a quick stay to catch a shuttle to the airport. Really great for that!

review.title: dirty bath tab
review.reviewText: The bottom of the bath tab was extremely dirty .I mentioned this to reception but there was no change for the second night

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: The front desk attendant was very helpful even though there was no power because of the storm. I was able to get into the room and rest. Thank him. I don't know his name.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: Too noisy, fumes coming under door from vehicles parked outside. Close toSFO airport with good shuttle service 24/7.

review.title: Great stay for travellers
review.reviewText:
The first impression is that quality of the room is not as good as the photos in the web. However, the layout is just exactly the same as I check on the web. I feel very comfortable when I sit in front of the desk; and I find that even though the space is not big but the layout is great for working on the desk. The lamp design is also very great for working on the desk. The heater is put on the right place. The bed and pillow is very good too. I have a sound sleep. 24 hrs restaurant is very convenient and Its food is OK too. Shuttle service is good too.
Even though my room is near the road, it is quiet when the door is shut.
review.positiveRemarks: layout of the room, free internet, TV program, shuttle bus and a nearby restauruant
review.negativeRemarks: no coffee maker in the room

review.title: comfortable stay for the price
review.reviewText:
Seamless....

1. shuttle service to/from airport was prompt
2. Neighborhood was good, with a bay view at few steps cross the road
3. Pleasant staff
4. wifi connectivity was our only concern.if you plan to work during your holiday... You may wanna make sure of this aspect with hotel before you book It

Good worth for the price you pay !!
review.positiveRemarks: Condition and comfort of the room, transport connectivity,courteous staff
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi
review.locationRemarks: Good neighborhood... Close to airport, 3-5 miles away from shopping

review.title: Red Roof Inn A+++++
review.reviewText: I would recommend The Red Roof Inn to all especially those who are travelling to & from the SFO Airport, excellent service.. Excellent 24 hour restaurant from off the Lobby. Easy shuttle service to & from the airport. Clean rooms, nice walk beside the water...
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms & the24 hour restaurant hooked onto the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near the airport.

review.title: This is no luxury hotel, but it did the job well
review.reviewText: After reading the mixed reviews I was weary to book this motel but I couldn't pass up the price so I went for it. I was happy to see they had free shuttle 24-hour service to and from the airport, it took a little while to come but the gentleman helped me with my bag and promptly got me there. The gentlemen that checked me in were a bit creepy but I half expected that since I was a young woman traveling alone. The elevator was a bit unnerving, and seemed outdated. The room was a lot nicer than expected. But there is no refrigerator or microwave.The beds were clean and very comfy and the room was clean as well. The bathroom was mostly clean but the bottom of the shower was a little dark and stained it looked like it needed a good scrubbing. The door did let in quite a bit of noise but I was so tired I didn't care personally, sensitive sleepers should bring earplugs. The hotel staff in the morning were very friendly and let me stay a little bit after checkout. They also showed me how to get to the greyhound station without paying for an expensive cab since I was not familiar with San Francisco at all. Overall, pleasurable experience for the price, I would come here again.

review.title: Good shuttle.
review.reviewText: Excellent airport shuttle. No fridge or coffee maker in room. Rooms were good and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: No coffee maker. No decaf coffee in lobby.
review.locationRemarks: 10-15 minutes to airport depending on how many passengers.

review.title: Decent hotel with good connectivity to SFO
review.reviewText: Its a decent hotel, the thai restaurant was very good. Almost all asians will love it and it is the restaurant that is operated for 24hrs. The shuttle operated by the hotel was very useful.
review.negativeRemarks: not much things for entertainment

review.title: cheap hotel
review.reviewText: room was small . bed was ok.walls and doors let in a lot of noise, more than most hotels
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: One night stay
review.reviewText: The room was very clean but the hotel itself could use a face lift. Elevator was a little scary.
review.positiveRemarks: Very convenient to San Francisco Airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a face lift.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to rental car return at San Francisco Airport.

review.title: Ok for one night but spendy.
review.reviewText: Room was ok for a one night stay. New paint and bedding. Nice tv. Disappointed in cleanliness of bathroom. Only one washcloth and It was dirty. Almost like housekeeping didn't finish putting all linens in the bathroom. Front desk was swamped which made it slow. Nice and helpful staff however. Rate was expensive for quality.

review.title: bathtub
review.reviewText: the bath tub was black on the bottom and needed a good scrubphg

review.title: Great budget airport hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was the perfect budget experience. We were looking for a low cost option for our last night in San Francisco. The Red Roof Inn was just that and more. They are close to the airport and offer a free shuttle that runs on time. The room was clean and modern and significantly less expensive than its nearby competitors. We'd definitely stay again!

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: My stay was nice. Room was in good condition. Bathroom could have been a little cleaner.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was open 24/7 and had great food even at 3:00 in the morning! The cleaning crew was excellent and even came back and cleaned the room when I had forgotten to take off the do not disturb sign. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: The location was not ideal.
review.reviewText:
My main problem with this hotel was its location. I was unfamiliar with the area and it's loop traffic system so it was very very confusing to get to this hotel which was 'over the bridge' from the main part of town and other main roads. It took me three frustrating days to get the hang of it.

The room was clean and small. It had a heated pool that my son liked and the diner on the 1st floor was pretty good. And most of all, the price was right.

review.title: No, No...
review.reviewText: This is not a good place to stay. It is not horrible but we dint shower that day because the bathroom had stained in the bottom, so...

review.title: good stay
review.reviewText: Marred by inability to use WiFi on my android. Otherwise quiet and comfortable. Good Cafe attached.
review.negativeRemarks: no wifi
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Decent airport hotel
review.reviewText: A decent budget hotel. A good place to rest for a night after a long international flight.

review.title: Great staff.
review.reviewText: The staff were very helpful giving directions to a wonderful local restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly, helpful staff. Also the nearby walking trail.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from children in the halls.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport.

review.title: Convenient for SFO travel
review.reviewText: The room was clean, fairly bare bones but that was all we needed. It came with too few towels and there were no bottles of shampoo in the bath. I had to go hunt down a maid cart for shampoo. Also, there were no instructions for the phone system so when I wanted to call the front desk to tell them about the lack of amenities, I couldn't figure out how to reach it. The rate was very good and the shuttle service to SFO makes it a recommended choice, despite the problems, and the connected restaurant was decent and convenient.

review.title: Ok stay at ok price
review.reviewText: Swimming pool is nice, especially with kids. Basic rooms, clean. Very convenient location near the airport. The restaurants and shops of Burlingame are available.

review.title: Just right
review.reviewText: It was just right. Clean, comfortable, safe, & quiet.

review.title: Good for layovers
review.reviewText: Stayed here for an 18 hour layover so wanted somewhere convenient to SFO and downtown. This hotel offered a free shuttle, which runs 24 hours on a schedule, to and from SFO - the BART station is located in the airport as well so shuttle was perfect for us. Overall hotel was clean as was the room which had an ironing board and personal coffee maker but free coffee was available in the hotel lobby as well. I would recommend for layovers but if you are planning a trip to SF to sight see it is far from downtown and while BART is one of the cheaper options it is still pricey for a family of 4 (as we are) to trek everyday. Round trip tickets for 4 adults was $64.00. That's SFO to Powell Street station and back. To sum up, the hotel is clean, reasonably priced and in a quite location but a bit far from attractions.

review.title: Top Spot for flights out of San Fran
review.reviewText: This is the 2nd time that I have stayed here and would stay again, They have just redone the place and it looks great they go out of there way to help with anything and the shuttle is a added bonus
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing all good
review.locationRemarks: they have a diner attached so dont have to go out to eat

review.title: excellent!
review.reviewText:
Excellent value hotel.Comfortable ,well equipped, quiet spacious room.Very frequent,efficient airport transfers with no need to book either.
No hesitation in recommending it.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: no airport noise

review.title: Functional not frilly with 24/7 basic restaurant
review.reviewText: 24/7 basic restaurant on premises (rare in my experience), adequately clean and furnished room, functional not frilly, quiet (away from elevators and driveways, not much foot traffic down passageway), crowded parking lot (including several big buses) yet I didn't experience crowds of people (perhaps my schedule didn't match theirs), saw several airline crew members (again, functional situation)
review.negativeRemarks: No microwave or refrigerator; crowded parking lot
review.locationRemarks: Reasonably close to airport

review.title: San Fransisco
review.reviewText: The room was clean and the house cleaning service was very good. The restaurant left something to be desired but otherwise, friendly and decent place to stay for the cost
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant and small bath towels
review.locationRemarks: Very good for what we were looking for

review.title: Red roof inn
review.reviewText: Older and a little run down. I wasn't impressed at all.

review.title: Economical and met all expectations.
review.reviewText: I wanted an economical place to stay near the SFO airport. My wife chose Red Roof Inn. It met all our expectations. They have a 24 hour shuttle that leaves twice an hour. Great if you have an ultra-early morning flight like I did. Refrigerator and coffee maker inside. Clean room with a comfortable desk area. And a 24 hour restaurant for a meal or just a beer to chill out. Free wi-fi that worked from the restaurant and room just fine. I will choose Red Roof Inn SFO Airport again.
review.positiveRemarks: Economical, clean, with just the right amenities I needed.

review.title: Pleasant, Easy Access and Clean
review.reviewText: Very close and easy drive to/from SFO airport. I liked the relative quite and calm of the location on the penninsula. Room was very clean and staff very nice and responsive. Pleased with the nice 40" flatscreen HDTV (not what I expected in a budget hotel).
review.positiveRemarks: Appreciated the relative ease of getting to and from the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Ice machine on my floor wasn't working
review.locationRemarks: Loved the solitude and calm around the penninsula area

review.title: It was just okay.
review.reviewText: It took forever for the free shuttle to show up at the airport. All else was okay for a one night stay that was close to the airport but I don't think I would stay there again.

review.title: Good hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Hotel just being revamped, rooms clean and comfortable on a budget price. On site restaurant have good friendly staff. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Newly revamped rooms and on site restaurant/diner.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Inexpensive and airport friendly
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel for a quick overnight stay near the airport. There is a 24 hour diner and also a free airport shuttle. The staff was very personable and professional.
review.positiveRemarks: Free airport shuttle, great staff, 24 hour diner
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel is not enclosed...room doors open to outside.
review.locationRemarks: Great location if you're flying the next day.

review.title: Awesome!!!
review.reviewText: The front desk staff are awesome . . . :) They are courteous and helpful.

review.title: Need some coffee
review.reviewText: There wasn't a coffee pot in the room. Would like to have a coffee pot in the room and a little refrigerator.

review.title: Family friendly
review.reviewText: We took a quick trip in stayed two nights with our kids. The hotel was clean, The rooms were small. The staff was nice. We will go back for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: great price for a place to sleep
review.negativeRemarks: room was small for 4 people
review.locationRemarks: location was beautiful near the lagoon.

review.title: Great location for SFO!
review.reviewText: The location is so convenient for travel from SFO. It is a lovely setting next to the water, and there is a 24 hour restaurant as well as free shuttle service to the airport.

review.title: Over night stay
review.reviewText: The room was clean and comfortable. The room heater temperature could not be regulated. It was eithe hot of cool, nothing in between no matter where you set the dial. The 24-hour restaurant was convenient and the food was okay. The staff was friendly and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: The airconditioner/heater
review.locationRemarks: Convenient for an early morning flight out of SFO.

review.title: Very Eventful Hotel
review.reviewText: I guess the bad omen started when the toilet didn't flush. Good thing my husband is a handyman & got it to work. The room is not spectacular but ok. A pet-friendly hotel except that the room next door lost their pet and owner started screaming and we witnessed and heard everything! The most unpleasant event was when a drunken group started yapping outside our door at 2:00 a.m.!!!! They woke us up as they didn't want to leave -- phoned front desk clerk but the group didn't leave until about 45 min. later. Other than it was time for us to check out -- thank God!!!!!

review.title: Avoid or bring ear plugs
review.reviewText:
I was not expecting much from this location and I didn't even get that. The staff were professional, but not particularly courteous or inviting (but not rude either). Walking to my room I was greeted by beer cans lining the stairs which led me to believe that I was in for a long night (which I was). Inside my room the bedroom area was fine, but the bathroom area was definitely showing signs of fatigue with missing paint and just a general sense of "past due for refresh".

The real issue I had with the room was that the volume inside the room was equal to the volume outside the room. I am not sure if my particular room was missing sound deadening material, but given that the hotel is right next to the highway and airport I was expecting there to be some consideration for noise. I could easily have participated with the conversations that occurred in the parking lot and was intimately aware of any arrival to SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level in room
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient; located right next to the highway and airport.

review.title: if all RRI's are like this there will be no around
review.reviewText:
My first RRI stay ... if they're all good as this it'll be a no brainer!

Great decor ... work station in room, huge king bed ... shower, heating/cooling all in working order.

The American/Asian diner attached [Leanne's?] very poor ... go slightly further afield for eats!
review.positiveRemarks: Location for SFO ... Decor ... virtually brand new
review.negativeRemarks: The diner ... maybe separate, but, very, very disappointing!
review.locationRemarks: Great for SFO ... 6 minute drive to car rental return

review.title: Fine for a place to sleep
review.reviewText: If you only need a place to sleep, then this hotel was clean and comfortable enough for that. If you actually want to enjoy your hotel room, you're better off somewhere else.
review.positiveRemarks: There's a convenient 24 hour restaurant, Leann's, attached to the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators were slow and the rooms not very well lit
review.locationRemarks: Location was conveniently near the freeway and 5 minutes drive from the airport

review.title: Pet Friendly
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel to use if you are planning to bring your dog with you.

review.title: Red Roof, Third or Fourth Stay...
review.reviewText: Travelers will want to consider requesting a room on the side "away from" the airport! Perhaps due to all the "holiday" traffic, there seemed to be much more NOISE from planes, cars, and buses than in the past! I stay here regularly. In the future, no question, I will request a room on the side "away from" the airport!
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to airport and parking area I always use; I have my routine established!
review.negativeRemarks: Too much "holiday" traffic noise: planes, cars, buses on my 'side' of inn. In future, will request room on 'other' side of inn!
review.locationRemarks: Height of convenience!

review.title: Very simple but does the job comfortably
review.reviewText: It's comfortable, no frills. The noise from outside could be disturbing but once you're asleep, it doesn't matter. I didn't hear a peep from my neighbours so the walls are nice and solid. Coffee in the room was nice and the shuttle was invaluable.
review.negativeRemarks: Deodorizer in the room was a bit strong.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame next to the Double Tree.

review.title: 3 night stay
review.reviewText: dirty sheets and pillow covers, spotty towels. good coffee.

review.title: clean and comfortable
review.reviewText:
We were excited to find a clean, friendly location that didn't charge an extra pet fee for our little dog. There is a great walking/bike path right outside and a fenced dog park. Additionally, one can walk along the bay and see wildlife and the planes gently cruising into SFO. We weren't troubled by noise at all.

We checked in late and had no problems whatsoever.

review.title: Courteous staff, good restaurant on premises
review.reviewText: Good accommodations for the price! Room satisfactory, but no refrigerator & microwave as advertised. Wi-fi hookup convenient and accessible. Only annoying problem reported to supervising housekeeper was smoke-filled elevator with posted "no smoking" sign. Made us think staff member sneaking a smoke in the elevator.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: Sandy
review.reviewText: good hotel !! nice staff

review.title: Basic clean quality for the price
review.reviewText: Very clean room space, shuttle to the SFO, free coffee/tea in the lobby. The first look of the lobby - it is shockingly basic. Location close to DoubleTree, so one can always use the Burlingame trolley that stops at DoubleTree but not Red Roof.

review.title: Good Value compared to the others in the area
review.reviewText: The room was clean, cheery, and functional. Everything looked pretty new and tastefully designed and worked as expected. Missed coffee in the room but it was short walk to the lobby to get one. Bring a travel mug to make your trip worthwhile they had little dinky Styrofoam ones. The sheer inner curtain that allows privacy in daytime was missing. No free continental breakfast and the attached restaurant did not have many inexpensive options. But you don't get free breakfasts at the more expensive neighbor hotels either. It was close to SFO and I think they had a shuttle. I drove and the parking was free.The free wireless worked fine. Overall it was an affordable option near other conference hotels.

review.title: Comfortable place to stay
review.reviewText: This was just your basic hotel-nothing too fancy, but nothing to complain about. The room was clean, service was friendly, and the restaurat was conveniently located within the hotel. Parking was occasionally difficult to find, the elevator was temporarily out of order and there was no fridge in the room.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: Only stayed here because it was close to the airport and they offered a free shuttle to and from the airport. We woke up at 3 for a 6 am flight and we couldn't even take a shower. There was no hot water at all. I called the front desk and they told me to run the shower for a bit. They also said they would get someone to look into it and call me back. I ran that shower for 45 mins and the temp never increased. There was also no call back or inquest when we checked out. Horrible way to start your trip home.
review.locationRemarks: Stay in Norther San Fran by the fishermans wharf. So much to do and wonderful people. Can't wait to go back!

review.title: Great for what it is
review.reviewText: It's all about convienence to the airport. This hotel is in an area of hotels and for the money it works great. Not the least is the 24 hour restaurant off the lobby. Not the greatest food but all the other hotels do not cater to people who arrive late and need to eat. Where the other hotels have vending machines these folks serve meals. Makes you wonder why you would pay more when you just need to be close to the airport.

review.title: Good Stop-Over Hotel
review.reviewText:
We were completely satisfied with our stay at the Red Roof Inn. The room was large and clean, the bed was comfy and quiet and we were really close to a nice walking path to get some exercise. We appreciated how close it was to the airport and the complementary shuttle service.

While there aren't many restaurants in the area there is one attached to the hotel and another great one "Kincaids" a few blocks away.

We'd definitely stay here again.

review.title: Ok airport hotel
review.reviewText:
If you just need a place to stay close the SFO, Red Roof is the place. Nice rooms, nice beds etc. but nothing extraordinary.

However, the restaurant next door is not worth it!

review.title: Friendly, clean, a good value
review.reviewText: This is convenient to the airport, with really friendly service. It's worth the extra small charge for a superior room, with nicer linens and better space. 24 hour restaurant, owned independently, and serving real food.

review.title: Just fine
review.reviewText: Fine

review.title: Free Pet Stay and Free Wifi!
review.reviewText:
I was very satisfied staying at Red Roof Inn in Burlingame. It's a short drive to Union Square one of the main areas in San Francisco- took about 15-20 mins. And is only a few miles away from the San Francisco Airport. Plus they have 24 hour shuttles that bring you to the airport every 30 minute.

We stayed in a room with two full beds. It was very clean.The best part is that they are a pet friendly hotel and there is no additional charge. Also, there is free WiFi! So if you need to use your laptop and do work it's very convenient.

Overall, very pleased with the stay. Will come back again if bringing a pet!

review.title: Pet friendly
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was extremely helpful, cheerful, and efficient - a welcome change from the robot-like front desk staff I usually encounter.

review.title: "...Most convenient!"
review.reviewText: My third or fourth stay at this Red Roof Inn. Location, most convenient to SFO and to preferred long-term parking; area is quiet, attractive. Twenty-four-hour cafe is convenient, welcoming. A few years ago, "dated" inn underwent a bit of "sprucing up" and is now a bit more attractive. It's good to know my SFO flight plans are made easier by this Red Roof Inn!

review.title: Convenient location by the airport, best prices around
review.reviewText:
No frills, but it does have free wi-fi and in-room safe (which Doubletree, across the street and about twice as expensive, doesn't). Good enough for a couple nights' stay. Nice 24-hour diner-style restaurant. Not sterile, but clean enough for non-OCD types. Friendly and helpful staff.

The 24 hour airport and BART shuttle is convenient, but still, I wouldn't recommend staying here for San Francisco sightseeing unless you get a car. The savings will be offset by the time-consuming commute to the city (about an hour each way by shuttle and BART).

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: close to highway, nice.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText:
unfortunately I was located next to a 'utility/electrical' room and every few minutes I had to hear a compressor or some horribly loud machine complete a cycle.

The idea was to get a good nights sleep before a 25hour trip (which I assume is the main reason people overnight there) ..and that didn't happen.

Additionally the door was missing a type of rubber seal, so light an sound came in (sound as if the door was wide open). So that was a major negative. Luckily it was summer and not cold.

review.title: hard beds
review.reviewText: The beds were extremely hard, which made for very little sleep. The room was very clean and quite. It was convenient for our business. The desk clerk was very helpful with directions.

review.title: Not much better than a Motel 6
review.reviewText: The motel was fine for what it was. I was expecting more from a 2.5 star rated property, though. Much more of a well-maintained 1-star rated motel.

review.title: Staff was WONDERFUL.
review.reviewText: The staff was the best! I would go back. My two doggies, brother, sister-in-law and neice just loved the room. I did kind of miss a microwave and refrid. though. Next time we will get a room with one in it.

review.title: Basic Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a good basic hotel to stay in if , for instance, you are flying out the next day , and they will keep your car there for a nominal daily charge.. No free breakfast , however the on site restaurant is open 24 hours, so it's convienent, if you have to get up at 3:00 AM to catch a flight and need a bite to eat. The hotel does have exterior doors.

review.title: fine for night's sleep near airport
review.reviewText: perfectly adequate

review.title: Good for the money
review.reviewText:
Central location close to SFO and main highways to get up or down the peninsula quickly, or hop on the San Mateo Bridge and go to the East Bay in just a couple minutes.

The building is a little older, could use some updating, but appeared well maintained and was fairly clean. If you're a business traveler who does more business and less sitting in your room, this is a good place to plunk your head on a pillow for a night and get a shower and get back to it the next day.

Service staff was friendly, efficient and helpful.

review.title: Great experience again
review.reviewText:
Seems like our room was recently renovated and was tastefully decorated with great furniture and fixtures. Service at desk was excellent.
ade and changed (my mistake) future reservations with helpful and happy desk clerk. Will stay again and do recommend for others.

review.title: my business trip
review.reviewText: the room was fine for the price. close to the airport, easy to get on/off the hi-way.

review.title: Not the cleanest
review.reviewText: Where to start... The hotel was suppose to have easy access from hwy 101. It did but only from the north bound side south bound was a bit tricky. It would have been nice to know this ahead of time. The room was sufficient, however I had booked a no smoking room and there was a defenite tobacco odor in the room when we walked in. The room contained 2dbls. Only 1 of the beds had been changed. The sheets on the other had hair and debris from the previous occupant (VERY disconcerting!) The bathtub looked as though it had not been scrubbed recently and lastly the coffee maker did not have a pot to go with it. The staff was very friendly at the front desk. I would however not stay here again because of the poor job done by the housecleaning staff.

review.title: No more Red Roofs for me.
review.reviewText: Service was terrible. Man at front desk gave me wrong room number and then yelled at me when I came back to say the key did not open the specified door. Lobby was infested with smoking and stinked. The room was worse in terms of stench and cleanliness. Blanket and pillow filled with stench. Rooms are not safe for children because you enter the rooms from outside. Those on floors two and up had to walk a narrow outside pathway to the rooms. Not recommended for those with small children who could fall. The hotel looked nothing like the ad on the webpage. The hotel claims there's a swimming pool, but I saw none.

review.title: If traveling with kids and cost is a factor, this hotel meets the bill.
review.reviewText: Close enough to SF and comes with a pool. The ice machines are kept full and house keeping is very responsive. The on site restaurant was a surprise as it serves tasty food at a reasonable price.

review.title: Substandard
review.reviewText: No coffee machines in the room, no free breakfast, no refrigerators. The Internet is free but extremely slow and often down. Over the 4th of July weekend I did not get my room cleaned three days in a row. No privacy with curtains open, since walkways leading to the rooms are outside in front of the windows.

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText: The Red Roof Inn that we stay in Burligame, CA has sign on the wall at the reception area saying "chemical substance is known in the area by the state of California and harm to cancer and side defect for pregnants". I don't know what kind of chemical as it is not stated on the sign.

review.title: Good bang for your buck
review.reviewText: Hey it's a Red Roof Inn! Good coffe shop on site. Much better then a Denny's! We saw a lot of fight attendents staying there. For us that's a good sign for a place at this level.

review.title: I've had better
review.reviewText: The hotel was cheap and convenient but there were shady people hanging out of there rooms. The only room left was a smoking so it did not smell nice and was not the cleanest of rooms.

review.title: Did its purpose
review.reviewText: Just looking for an economical overnight stay near SFO, with a free shuttle service. This fit the bill. Room was clean enough, but there seemed to be an mild (as opposed to over-whelming) odor of urine coming from the AC unit. It may have been something else, and I hope it was. They were sold out otherwise, compliments of United's computer problems, otherwise I would have tried another room.

review.title: OK airport motel
review.reviewText: for me room look like all motel 6 rooms , but clean and nice staff

review.title: average stay
review.reviewText: Give yourself a little extra time if you are taking the shuttle to the airport.

review.title: Very good deal & location
review.reviewText: Easy to use 24 hr a day shuttle to BART & Airport, very pleasant staff and convenience of on site (basic) but reasonable restaurant - very good breakfast menu.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location on the San Francisco bay looking out at Oakland. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Especially the young woman at the front desk, who helped my friend and I figure out some public transportation questions and supplied us with a map and some very helpful suggestions. Aside from a mildly loose bathtub faucet, it was a great hotel with a great staff. The price was great and so was the location, 5 min from the airport and 20 min from downtown San Francisco. People who are easily bothered by noise might not fare well here due to the closeness of the airport, however neither me or my friend were bothered by the noise from the airport.

review.title: Really nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Traveled from southern California up to San Fransisco. What a great place to stay, only a ten minute drive to Downtown. It was a very comfortable place to stay, up to date rooms with mattreses you could get a good nights sleep on.

review.title: red roof, sf airport
review.reviewText: easy access, fine restaurants nearby and good hotel service

review.title: Chemist
review.reviewText: The dinner at the front of the hotel wasn't very good. The hotel was very nice for the price we paid and the last minute notice.

review.title: Ravi
review.reviewText: Nice decent stay...

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: good

review.title: Good Price and Good Hotel
review.reviewText: I have no complaints and highly recommend this clean and economical hotel.

review.title: Good Price!
review.reviewText: The room was clean and the cleaning staff was prompt, front desk workers were helpful and friendly. The price was really unbeatable - if you are looking for a clean, inexpensive hotel out by the airport - I would recommend staying here. The drive to downtown San Fran is about 15-20 minutes, straight shot down the hwy - easy to get to and from. The hotel also has a small diner attached to it, open 24 hours - very nice to have if you are looking for a quick/convenient meal.

review.title: Maybe, if the jobs of the housekeepers and front desk are switch.
review.reviewText: We were very unsatisfied with front desk workers, Maria and Guillermo.

review.title: one night
review.reviewText:
it was not a happy night
thank you

review.title: Good for a stayover only.
review.reviewText: If you are going to stay in San Francisco I wouldn't recommend this hotel. However, if you just want somewhere to stay for a night near the airport it isn't too bad. Staff were quite helpful.

review.title: deb
review.reviewText: will use this hotel on my next trip. the 24 hour cafe is great!

review.title: Good Experience, Good Service. I recommend it
review.reviewText: All the Experience was very Good, Clean facilities, Easy to get from San Jose Airport and very close to SFO at 5 Min away. The Room was as Pictured and shown in the Website of Expedia.

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: This is a decent place for the money. The only problems are the wi-fi, it is so slow you almost cannot use it, and it even interfered with my cell phone signal. They are aware of the problem and are planning on fixing it soon. Also, if you don't like noise, this is not the place for you, it is very noisy, from the nearby airport, highway and people talking loudly walking by your room, since it is an outside entry hotel. But it is still a good value for the money compared to other places in the same area. I love the fact they are pet-friendly and don't charge for your pets! I got the superior king room which had a microwave and fridge, and a safe for my belongings which was nice. There is a nice path to take a walk on towards the rear of the hotel, and a 24/7 on site restaurant, it seems like a little dive, but the food is really good, and the staff always friendly. There are no coffee makers in the rooms, but there is coffee 24/7 in the lobby free for guests. I also like the room's L shaped work station. If only the wi-fi was working better I could have stayed longer and got my work done! I liked this place enough to book another stay with them a week later, and had a few problems with things not working in the room, I told them upon check out, and they discounted me for the inconvenience.Pool is closed during winter, and there is no hot tub, but all the rooms have bathtubs which is nice.Overall, worth the price, and it seems to be in a safe area. I will stay there again.

review.title: definitely will go back
review.reviewText: the price for the hotel is reasonable and affordable.

review.title: Great Value/Location
review.reviewText: Compared to other close-proximity airport hotels, this is a very good property and a good value at the Expedia rate. It's looks to be built in the sixties as a Days Inn or Super 8 (guess) with doors facing to the outside rather than to an interior hall. It is well maintained and the room was very clean. Staff were friendly and efficient and there were frequent shuttles to the airport (allow for about a 30 min ride as the shuttle makes the circuit of several other local hotels). On-site 24 hour cafe was very average. Wifi was free, but slow. Recommended if you have an early morning flight out of SFO.

review.title: Hands down for the money, the best hotel and diner I've stayed at, ever. I'm still smiling.
review.reviewText: see above report. It's a 5 Star hotel, when the maximum is only 4 Stars.

review.title: Close to San Francisco airport and works well
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Frequent shuttles to airport starting before 5:00 AM. Fast free wireless. Decent on-site restaurant. And a low rate. Recommended if you have an early morning flight out of San Francisco.

review.title: Great value for the money!
