review.reviewText: Check in was quick and staff was pleasant. Room was simple but clean and comfortable. A bit noisy outside with delivery trucks? But solved that problem with earplugs. Connected to the lobby is a 24-hour café. Food was good, serves was pleasant. Possibly the only free parking hotel in the area. Overall a good experience.

review.title: Ideal for budget property near SFO
review.reviewText: This is a solid property for the value. Clean room with free wireless (albeit slow), friendly staff, acceptable TV selections, and a convenient 24-hour restaurant attached (think Denny's-style diner food and you'll be satisfied). The airport shuttle is shared with a few other local properties, and can get quite full in the morning rush. Be warned that airline crews have priority if seating capacity becomes an issue (you'd have to wait for the next shuttle).

review.title: jump off for a trip to the far east
review.reviewText: place to stay and park your car while on holiday. Close to the airport, rooms were clean and nice, I recommend it highly.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Definitely not the Ritz, but it is a good place to stay. No frills, but they had free internet and the staff was very friendly.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: Red Roof Inn is close to the airport, provides shulttle service from the airport, the staff are friendly, the rooms are roomy and clean. It was an economical value and I would stay there again.

review.title: I wasn't too impressed.
review.reviewText: Staff and hotel itself was okay. There were trash thrown around outside the rooms, swimming pool was rather unkept. It was a place to stay overnight before an international flight and I needed to sleep well, but the place was noisy. Parking lot was tight and trash thrown around as well. I wouln't go out of my way to recommend it to anyone.

review.title: not clean at all
review.reviewText: THE ROOM WAS NOT CLEAN, SMELL AND DIRT. SOMEOF MY ITEMS LOST, AND WHEN I CALLED TO REGET THEM, NO ONE WAS WILLING TO HELP.

review.title: Can't beat the Value & Price
review.reviewText: Good & Courteous service. I would definitely use them again. True, not luxurious, but they never claim to be as it's a good bargain w/no frills hotel/motel. Ironically, they don't charge anything for wifi which even luxury or premium hotels won't do so i was quite pleased with that.

review.title: Great bargin
review.reviewText: For the price, this is a great place to stay. The free shuttle to the B.A.R.T. is a added bonus. The only concern I would have, this hotel is 3 different buildings and there is alot of hallways and tunnels between them. I did not see any cameras at all, and the elevators were outdoors, and open to public. I would not feel safe here with children or teenagers. As for me, I would stay there again though.

review.title: Very good airport hotel
review.reviewText: A good airpor hotel

review.title: ok - 24 food - free parking - accepted my little dog!!!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was ok. Everything was clean, needed some tlc but the employees helpfulness compensated for the need for some upkeep.
The staff seems to take action when something needs to be done. For example: the security bolt was broken on my door and I called the front desk to ask for it to be repaired asap. A young man was right there to resolve the issue noting that it was an oversight for it to have not been addressed after the last occupant had broken it.
The rooms open onto an open corridor. Due to a lack of weather-stripping on the bottom of the door of the room, I requested a new room to avoid the cold draft caused by wind and rain. That brought about an interesting quest with the manager and a staff person having me accompany them to find an acceptable room, where I would not have to consider following up on the unacceptable suggestion that using a blanket or a towel would prevent the wind or dampness from entering my room.
Leann's, the 24 hour cafe attached to the Red Roof Inn, was good solid comfort food, and the staff was congenial and attentive.

review.title: Not a bad hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Over all my experience at this hotel was good. If I stay there again i would ask for a room away for the stairwell because of the traffic up and down the stairs.

review.title: Good for the money
review.reviewText: I got what I paid for.

review.title: Viater
review.reviewText: As I already said, everything was fine with the hotel. Great location and service, as well as facilities.

review.title: Fully satisfactory stay at low comparative cost.
review.reviewText: Restaurant in the building was fairly good.

review.title: Green Clean? Read....."Lazy"
review.reviewText: Now let's be fair. It's a Red Roof Inn. We weren't expecting 5 star comfort, but clean sheets, sufficient towels without having to repeatedly ask, and when they were brought after we'd gone for the day, they were plopped on our luggage! Not hung up....PLOPPED on open luggage. Not only that, but because of their "green clean" policy, they did NOTHING but make the bed...no vacuuming, no cleaning counters OR TUBS. When I asked for a full cleaning, they were snippy and rude as if I had no right to request enough towels or a clean tub. Also...the "comfy" chair was greasy and no one could sit on it...and it never got cleaned. So....if you're looking for a place only to crash, close to the airport with easy freeway access...this is your place....'cuz you won't get much else.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Good experience

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was very conveniently located near the airport and freeway. It was a short drive to everything I needed in my business trip. The room was a good size, very clean, and outfitted with wifi, a desk, mini fridge, microwave, and a fairly comfortable bed. The price cannot be beat.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay in San Francisco. Easy drive to downtown and places like Half Moon Bay. We had a great time.

review.title: Cheaper alternative to the Doubletree across the street
review.reviewText: I had to go to a conference at the Doubletree San Francisco Airport, but got a cheaper price at the Red Roof Inn across the street. It's not fancy, but it's clean. The doors open to the outside (not to an indoor hallway like the Doubletree) there are 5 stories, if I remember right. I was on the 3rd. Easy to get there with elevator or stairs. Staff were friendly. There is free wi-fi in the (very small) lobby, and also in the restaurant that is connected to the building. You can pay $10 for wi-fi in your room. The neighborhood is quiet, several office buildings around, not much traffic on the weekend. If you don't have a car, you won't go far, but if you just have a weekend conference, it's fine. The restaurant connected to the Red Roof Inn is very good if you order Asian food. If you order Mexican or American, it's not too great.

review.title: It was an adventure
review.reviewText: Conveniently located south of SFO with free parking. Hotel offered free shuttle service to SFO with a convenient stop at the BART station. Took an easy and comfortable BART ride into the City eliminated the hassles of parking and driving in town. Overall, a good deal. Room was adequate and clean.

review.title: Red Roof Inn--Motel, not "Inn." Clean.
review.reviewText: It's a budget motel, about the same level as motel 6. My room was clean and comfortable. Very close to the airport. I would stay here again. I ate at the 24 hour cafe and had a Chinese chicken dish that was quite good. The cafe floor, however, was disgustingly greasy and dirty. My 1-5 rating is based on the utility of a budget motel.

review.title: We got what we paid for.
review.reviewText: it was reasonable priced hotel.

review.title: be back soon!
review.reviewText: I am always impressed with Red Roof at SFO. I try to stay a couple days each month and I always recommend it to many of my friends. I cannot think of one negative thing about them. It fits my budget.

review.title: Would recommend to friends
review.reviewText: Would recommend to a friend -

review.title: i would like to go back
review.reviewText: nice and quite place

review.title: Should have had chosen it as first choice..
review.reviewText: If I knew it before planning my trip to San Francisco, would have chosen it as a first grade option, it was worth it.

review.title: Pet Friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: I thought everything went smoothly and well when we were at the hotel. I think the hotel only allows pets under 25lbs but we have a 50lbs boxer/pit and they still allowed it. Our dog never barked so that helped; overall the experience was great.

review.title: Was an excellent hotel for the value, would recommend it to anyone!
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel for the value, I would recommend this property to anyone.

review.title: Nicely remodeled rooms
review.reviewText: The rooms were newly remodeled, pretty and comfortable. The shuttle service and location make it easy to get to and from the San Francisco airport. The 24 hour restaurant next door was also a plus. My only displeasure was the seeming lack of maintenance, as the lobby coffee machine, the soda and ice machines on the 4th floor, and one of the elevators were all out of order. Some people were stuck in the elevator when it stopped working. I would stay there again, but be cautious about using the elevator!

review.title: not impressd
review.reviewText: The number one thing was there internet service was down . that was extremely important to me

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Good price but hotel beds were not comfortable

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: Clean room. Not overpriced.

review.title: will go back
review.reviewText: very clean

review.title: You can find a better hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel had a bad maintenance, poor amenities and bad service. Choose this hotel only if you dont have a better place to go.

review.title: Put your bags or come to sleep only !
review.reviewText: The Inn is good for getting a cheap room to put your bags in and go out to visit the beautiful city and then probably return to just sleep and get moving ! Stay here if you are short on cash or want to put it to better use, and I found it most convenient for bachelor blokes! Things which irked most : The wash basin is outside the washroom/bathroom. So say you brush your teeth outside in the main room and then go in for a bath... not sure about all rooms, but two rooms which we rented were like this ! secondly, they have this large glass window adjacent to the door which is covered by a drape, but anybody can try to get a sneak peak inside the room from the common corridor outside the room. This is a case with all the rooms at the Inn... so not good for privacy !

review.title: Excellent price for an airport area hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: More cell phone reception in room for ground and second floors. Small tissue pack and is not in a box.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel is good for the price and near to the airport. But only the problem is quite far from San Francisco downtown.

review.title: red roof inn SF
review.reviewText: It was a little old, but large enough and very cheap. I was satisfied.

review.title: Good for one night
review.reviewText: Hotel good situation for the airport.Good service for the shuttle.Room is correct for one night.The floor of the bathroom is used and not very clean but the bath is very clean.The sheets was cleans.The beds are double bed and confortable.So good for the price and situation for one night.Restaurant in the hotel was ok.It is an industriel area so not restaurant near the hotel.

review.title: Horrible, I will never go back.
review.reviewText: This hotel wasn't clean we had stains on all our piillowcases, it didn't have a shower curtian when we checked in...we ended up taking the one out of the room next to us. There were urine stains all over the room from pervious dogs staying there. By the end of the stay we found out the room was supposed to be rented out due to it being maintained.

review.title: Pretty good for the price
review.reviewText: So the hotel is pretty much as expected: clean, well out of traffic's way, A/C didn't work very well and was very noisy. Service was good and I can't complain unless it gets real hot!

review.title: Perfect for the qucik stopover
review.reviewText: For a cheap night near the airport this place can't be beat. Room was clean and the hotel is right next to some "higher rent" hotels in a nice area and shares an airport shuttle bus with them. It even has a 24 hr Denny's type place right there which was damn good.

review.title: Awsome
review.reviewText: This hotel was overall a really good place to stay, Cost effective, comfortable, and clean rooms. The pool was refreshing and there was a restuarant right next door with good food and beer.

review.title: Practicall, not posh.
review.reviewText: Good shuttle; satisfactory restaurant adjancent; must cross a busy street to fitness facility but good area for a run along the bay. Good staff. Only thing that didn't work was the room's keyboard which the desk clerk replaced immediately on request.

review.title: Fine for an overnight stay
review.reviewText: Based on the price of the room, I got what I paid for and expected. The room was clean and had the basic amenities. You will hear airplanes flying by, but nothing earth-shattering. Would stay again if had to have a quick overnighter.

review.title: Met the minimum requirements
review.reviewText: The stay and location was conveniently near to the conference site we attended. A no-frills solution to other pricier stays. More like a motel or motor lodge than an "inn" but you get the idea. Odd choice of room decor. No in-room coffee maker and lobby one was broken but connecting diner was convenient.

review.title: Good cheap place to stay!!!
review.reviewText: Overall Red Roof Inn is a good place to stay while in San Francisco, it's cheap but it's in a safe area (also near the airport). There's a resturant at the hotel and vending machines on each floor for both snacks and soda located next to the ice machines. The ONLY problem I have with the hotel so far is that their keys don't ever seem to work right. They warn you to keep the key away from ANYTHING basically (credit cards, laptops, etc.) and both me & my boyfriend keep our cards away from everything and they STILL didn't work the next day when we returned to the room after being gone all day. I never have this problem at any other hotel when I keep the key in my purse.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Overall this is a great place to stay for a good price. Me and a couple of friends stayed here for new years. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. There's a good resturant attached to the hotel called Leanne's which serves american and chinese food.

review.title: A perfect place to stay when waiting for an early morning flight.
review.reviewText: My 67 year old parents and I were looking for a hotel for a single night stay since we had an early morning return flight to Canada. Overall, the hotel was very nice and clean. The front desk staff was pleasant and accommodating. Since my father has a mobility problem, I was pleasantly surprised to find an elevator in what you could effectively define as a multiple story "motel". The only slightly negative aspects were a few loud noises outside the door as other guests arrived later that night. As well, the complimentary coffee was in the lobby rather than having personal coffee makers in the room. For the length of our stay, however, it was perfect. I would definitely recommend it.

review.title: Value for Money
review.reviewText: The rooms are very clean and the mattress firm. Overall, a nice inn to stay for my transit nite.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Not a luxury hotel, but room was very comfortable and clean. Staff was friendly.

review.title: Great option for overnight layover
review.reviewText: We had a late flight arrival and early departure the next morning. The Red Roof Inn SF Airport was a great value for the money. Easy and quick shuttle service, 24 hour restaurant with surprisingly good food (although the decor could be updated and cleaned up), and clean room. We will definitely stay again if we have a layover in SF.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: We only needed a room for 1 night,before our flight out of SFO. For a 1 night stand, it worked just fine. It was clean and the beds were comfortable and the price was right.

review.title: Good budget hotel
review.reviewText: Just needed inexpensive place to stay close to the airport and this place fit the bill perfectly. Convenient 24-hour shuttle and clean but no-frills rooms. Check-in and out was super easy as everything was already pre-paid through Expedia.

review.title: clean and comftrable
review.reviewText: the room and bath were clean, not include breakfast, good for the price

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Extremely good value for location. If you need a place to sleep overnight before an early flight out, this is your spot! 24 Hour restaurant on premises and free coffee in lobby. Plus, pets allowed. I would call this a hidden gem.

review.title: okay place for business stay
review.reviewText: adequately clean, good food at the restaurant, comfortable beds. Free TV is very limited, the remote control for the TV is horrible.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Can't wait to go back

review.title: Recommend with reservations no pun intended
review.reviewText: The location is great. The price was right. The check-in was very slow (a whole shuttle-full showed up at 10PM on Saturday night and one over-worked agent trying to check everyone in). Even though we had reserved a non-smoking room, the only romm available was a smoking room. At that hour (and after a 4.5 hour flight), we decided to try it, and when the room was found to be a little musty, but not smoky, we kept it. On-site restaurant was good--if a bit pricey for a diner-type restaurant. No other dining choices--except hotel restaurants--are in walking distance. There is a great free trolley/shuttle into the town of Burlingame that run every hour to a great variety of restaurants and shops. Hotel shuttle runs to the airport (connection point to BART train to downtown San Francisco) reliably every 20 minutes. The lobby coffee machines are a nice touch, making hot chocolate, coffee and lattees. Not spectacular, but very adequate.

review.title: Very comfortable with free airport pickup
review.reviewText: Newly decorated room with comfortable bed. Very basic but we felt it was a great value for the price. Nice area to walk around also.

review.title: Clean, nice people. Good restaurant w/pleasant staff.
review.reviewText: Good place to stay. Nice people. Great restaurant 24hrs with sweet staff.

review.title: A OK place to stay.
review.reviewText: Compared to other hotels in area the rate is reasonable. Liked the fact of free parking and swimming pool. Restaurant on property. In back of property was a sidewalk and bench facing a canal.

review.title: Simple clean stay
review.reviewText: Simple airport hotel close to the water; heated pool; friendly staff. A bit noisy due to the freeway closeby. The 24-restaurant is good, friendly, clean - but it's not part of the hotel itself (i.e., no breakfast included, if you didn't note it in the reservation, like I didn't).

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The room is clean. We can see the bay and the SFO from the window of the room!

review.title: Very helpful staff
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Red Roof Inn.The hotel was very convenient to the shopping in downtown Burlingame. The hotel staff was very helpful when we experienced bad reception on the TV. They replaced the cable to the TV which had frayed over time. We had a nice breakfast at the restaurent on the premises.We recommend the hotel overall.

review.title: Great hotel for price
review.reviewText: It was great.

review.title: very quiet, comfy beds, but no cappucino
review.reviewText: Got lost trying to find the place.....was on Airport Blvd in South SF instead of Burlingame. Tried to call hotel twice and no one answered. Expedia was able to assist with directions. When we finally arrived, the desk clerk was grumping on the phone to a guest saying, "Try using a little common sense." However, he was professional enough toward me, although not overly friendly. The room had only 2 towels for 4 person occupancy, but in the morning, a friendly lady promptly brought more towels when asked to do so. The room was clean, and everything in working order. Parking was easy. I was looking forward to the promised cappucino in the morning, but it was all gone (the ad on Expedia said it was available all the time). We took the shuttle to the airport, which was convenient and reliable. Now that I know where-in-the-dickens it is located, I would stay again as long as the price were equal to or less than what I paid. Because I travel with children, I prefer places with interior corridors and complimentary breakfasts, so this hotel would probably not be my first choice. Apart from no cappucino, it delivered everything it promised, though.

review.title: n
review.reviewText: n

review.title: Good location & friendly staff
review.reviewText: Hotel has 4 things going for it: 1) Very friendly staff 2) Good location - minutes away from SFO & just a block from the bay -- with a nice jogging/bike/walking path along the bay 3) Free Shuttle that goes back & forth from airport every 20 minutes -- you can catch the free shuttle from hotel to International Departures, and then take the BARC train in to downtown San Fran for a little more than $5 4) Room is comfortable & cheery, beds good, outdoor pool, reasonably quiet, good block-out curtains Small problems: 1) Couldn't get connected to Internet -- might be jet lag (flew in from China) 2) Slight urine smell in bathroom - like it was in the linoleum/fake wood 3) There's a nice restaurant on site that serves hamburgers, Asian food, etc., but that's the only food choices in a one mile range. Other restaurants such as Western Sizzler are about a 2 mile walk along the bay (very pleasant walk and good for jet lag).

review.title: I was surprised
review.reviewText: All we wanted was a cheap place to stay during our business trip. A place to sleep, shower and shave. Other hotels in the surrounding area were much more expensive so we didn't really expect much. But we found the rooms were clean and the service personnel to be friendly and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: excellent no frills bargain
review.reviewText: Great location, minutes from SFO at a great price. Room was immaculate, appears to be very recently renovated. comfortable beds, good water pressure, acceptable tv. No hair dryer and the fan/AC was on the noisy side. Easy convenient free parking.

review.title: I'll be back (Red Roof SFO location)
review.reviewText: I had a good feeling about Red Roof Inn San Francisco from the start. Considering it had all good reviews, I booked this for the price, and location. The BEST coffee I've ever had at their free espresso maker, I miss it already. Room was cute, clean, and welcoming. The stay went smoothly, the ac/heat functioned properly, the 24-hour diner and also a fitness center access next door at the Doubletree were a bonus. Customer service was satisfactory. Nice fluffy pillows and free shuttle service to airport a plus. Free parking for your rentals. I heart Red Roof!

review.title: A good visit
review.reviewText: I've read the reviews and most are accurate. The airport noise was a whisper, but the early risers did not know the meaning of "quiet voice". The room was clean and comfortable; there was a microwave, fridge and TV with HBO and some basic cable channels. The restaurant near the lobby has decent food and is open 24 hours. The pool was fine but only opened whenever they decided to clean it. (Around 10:30 am.) The hotel is a stone's throw from Route 101. Walgreen's and Safeway are about 3 miles away. Elevator was a bit slow. Soft drink machine served warm soda but there are ice machines. The walkway in the back near the water is pleasant.

review.title: it was ok
review.reviewText: the hotel was clean just didn't like the soap and there was no hair dryer or enough towels

review.title: Golf Center right across the street
review.reviewText: This is a good place to stay if you are traveling with your pet. There is a nice walkway that connects a couple of hotels together and makes for a nice walk with your dog. There is a grassy area towards the rear of the hotel,which where we stayed and it made it convenient for those early/late potty times. There is a golf center across the street, great to spend some time close to the hotel. We also visited an animal shelter close by to visit with the animals for a little while.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and clean but the lights outside our room did not operate at night making it difficult to open our door in the dark. The free coffee was great the first morning but the machine was usually out of order every morning after.

review.title: Would return
review.reviewText: We were on the fourth floor on the bay side and could watch the airplanes come in over the bay to land from our window. Basic room but very clean, great beds/pillows and lots of hot water. Staff very friendly. We would definitely go back since location is easy to everything...APO, freeway, Burlingame and surrounding areas. Very little APO noise.

review.title: Okay place to stay
review.reviewText: The Red Roof Inn is a middle of the road sort of Hotel but it does give access to the trail by the Bay if you like to go out walking and it also offers an excercise room which is next door at the Double Tree. Also there are several eating establishments within 2-3 miles, also a Starbuck's. Golfing closeby as well.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: The door should have a seal on bottom. All noises from outside could be heard from bed.

review.title: a keeper
review.reviewText: nice quiet area, excellent restaurant, good food and friendly service

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: no hair dryer; bathtub backed up with water

review.title: I would go back
review.reviewText: Get a computer where the guest does not have to pay to use if you don't have a laptop.

review.title: Great for a quick stay
review.reviewText: We had a bachelorette party and some of the girls needed a hotel or were from out of town. It was close to San Francisco so we met there and had the party bus pick us up at the hotel. The rooms were a great price, clean and the hotel staff was very helpful. I would stay there again.

review.title: Super Service at reasonable rates
review.reviewText: The hotel had been recently renovated (2006 ?)and was clean and tidy. Beds were comfortable. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. It is not a luxurious place but certainly good value. The hotel is situated approx 3 miles from the airport. A complimentary 24 hour shuttle (about 20 minute intervals) from the hotel to the airport BART station allows easy access to downtown Frisco or points beyond. Cost to downtown on the BART $5.15. Hotel has a diner on site, but not much else is in the vicinity.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: We expected a typical moderate-budget hotel but were very surprised at the quality of the room. It was obvious that care had been taken to make the room feel more homey and comfortable, from the colorful walls to the faux wood floors in the bathroom. The small touches definitely added comfort to the room.

review.title: redroof
review.reviewText: overall, this hotel is fine. nothing really good or bad.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Hotel was really nice for the price. Beds were comfy and late checkout for people flying out on afternoon fliights a big plus for me. Will be back!!!

review.title: Got your money's worth
review.reviewText: This hotel was a last minute idea because our initial hotel filled up & we could not continue to stay there. As close to the airport that it is there was not a lot of plane noise. You can hear people talking when they walk past your room though. Staff was friendly & nice, room was what I expected. I'd stay there again. Convienant to San Fran, Coyote Pt., Burlingame, etc.

review.title: clean and new rooms
review.reviewText: room was clean, rooms were made up new

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: Check in was fast. Hotel is arranged oddly. Rooms were fairly quiet especially being next to the pool. Room smelled of mold and body odor. Towels were stained and were not used. Pillow cases and bed sheets had hair on them. Could be a good stay. You definitely get more for your money elsewhere in Burlingame/Millbrae. No fridge, no iron, no hairdryer, internet connection has a $10/day fee. No windows to open for fresh air. Left door open to air out the stale and odor.

review.title: lumpy bed
review.reviewText: well it was clean quiet and in every other way just fine however the bed clearly need to be replaced saggy.

review.title: would not recommend
review.reviewText: Assigned room which had not been cleaned.Given another room which was cleaned accept used towel hung behind the bathroom door.

review.title: An Average Hotel not looking forward to go back
review.reviewText: Unless one has business in the vicinity and needs a budget hotel it is a fine place.

review.title: Great for an early morning flight
review.reviewText: I would not recommend this hotel for a long stay. But it was great for one night before our early morning flight. The shuttle to the airport was very convenient.

review.title: Very good restaurant for a budget hotel!!
review.reviewText: A good place to stay, with a good restaurant and friendly staff.
